203501.name: The Coming Storm: The Red Cow Volume I
203501.description:
From the back cover:

JOIN THE HEROES OF THE RED COW

In Sartar, the Red Cow clan are surrounded by their enemies and occupied by the Lunar Empire. To their south the Culbrea tribe cast greedy eyes on the clan’s cows, to the north the treacherous Dinacoli seek vengeance for old wounds, and to the east the monstrous Telmori, a tribe of werewolves listen to a new leader, Jogar Sog, who calls on the wolfmen to slaughter their neighbors. The winds that bring the Hero Wars are blowing, can your heroes see your clan through The Coming Storm?

The Coming Storm is the guide to the Glorantha setting of the Red Cow clan in Sartar. With over 60 detailed and illustrated NPCs, write-ups of all major locations, maps, history of the Cinsina, and details of the neighbouring Dolutha, Two Pine, and Emerald Sword clans. Also covered are the Telmori werewolves, Wulfsland settlers, local rebel leaders and the ghouls of the Woods of the Dead. This book provides everything you need to run a classic clan-based Sartarite campaign.

The Coming Storm forms the setting for the forthcoming The Eleven Lights an epic campaign taking the Red Cow through the opening days of the Hero Wars from 1618-1625.

203502.name: Stormcloud Attack: Faith & Heresy
203502.description:
From the publisher:

The sky shall be your grave.

The galaxy of the 41st millennium burns, trapped in an unending war, with every race set against every other, in all imaginable theatres of war. A vital component of these battles is the desperate struggle for aerial superiority: wings of aircraft engaging in spectacular dogfights, weaving through storms of bullet hell, swooping into valleys to shake off enemies before unleashing incredible firepower, climbing at stunning speed to gain the perfect angle for a volley of missiles… the skies darken with fleets of combat aircraft vying for superiority, with the unfortunate second-best falling from the sky in spiralling pieces.

Stormcloud Attack: Faith & Heresy is an exciting stand-alone boxed game for two players, pitting flying machines from the 41st millennium against each other in thrilling single combat. It features a Space Marine Stormtalon Gunship and a Chaos Space Marine Heldrake, with an eighty-page softback Flight Manual detailing the awesome rules for stunning dogfighting manoeuvres, with a massive selection of missions, duels and dogfights.

CAMPAIGNS

The included Flight Manual contains a comprehensive guide to running your own Stormcloud Attack campaign – any number of players can take part, tracking the exploits of their pilot over the course of several engagements with a Pilot Record Card, watching them grow from a fresh-faced rookie to a grizzled fighter Ace. Each rank they gain grants them new and better abilities, meaning you can become a death-dealing monster of the skies and send your mates crashing and burning. Remember, there are no points for second best!

There’s even an exclusive transfer sheet with Ace decals and more included.

Also included are optional rules for Air Assaults – create special operations, capture ground targets and transport troops to and from important mission objectives.

203503.name: Stormcloud Attack: The Ancient & The Greater Good
203503.description:
From the publisher:

203504.description:
From the publisher:

It features an Eldar Crimson Hunter and an Ork Dakkajet, with an eighty-page softback Flight Manual detailing the awesome rules for stunning dogfighting manoeuvres, with a massive selection of missions, duels and dogfights.

CAMPAIGNS

There’s even an exclusive transfer sheet with Ace decals and more included.

Also included are optional rules for Air Assaults – create special operations, capture ground targets and transport troops to and from important mission objectives.

203505.name: Human, we have a problem
203505.description:
User Summary

Collect rocks and defend a tiny planet.

203506.name: Bank Robbers
203506.description:
In Bank Robbers players are competing to earn the most money by robbing banks. It's a hidden information, bluffing and deduction light family game.

During setup each player receives a hand of 5 cards and 10 coins which are placed in hidden place. Regardless of number of players there are always formed five banks on the table which receives one card each at the start of the game.

On a player's turn the player has to reveal one of the tiles that show which action she will perform. There are four possible actions:
1. Play a card - the player has to play a card from a hand face down to one of the five banks and then draw back to the hand of five cards.
2. Look at one card - The player has to look at one card which lays down at on of the bank while not showing it to other players.
3. Reveal one card - a player has to reveal and leave face up one of the cards laying in one of the banks.
4. Rob the bank - A player has to choose which bank the players will rob.

When robbing the bank each player chooses the amount of her money that she wishes to invest in robbing the bank. Then all amounts are revealed simultaneously. Then all the cards that lay face down in the bank are revealed and show the amount of money that can be robbed. The player who bids the least takes his loot first. She takes the money invested and the same amount from the bank following by other players. If there are insufficient money for one of the players she takes nothing from the bank and so do the players after her.

Apart from money cards there are also special cards which changes the outcome of the robbery:
Guard - Prevent the players from stealing the money. Everyone who invested 0 in this robbery receives 5 regardless of the money in the bank.
Thief - Prevent the players from stealing the money and also steals the money invested in this robbery by all players.
Judge - reverse the order of players taking the money.
Lady - Cancels all other special cards.

When the deck is depleted the play continues until one of the players use all of her cards. After that the players rob all the banks one after another and the game is over. The player who earned most coins is the winner.

203507.name: Character Options: Oracles
203507.description:
From publisher blurb:

Character Options is a series of short PDFs that present new options for a single character class.

In this volume:

3 New Oracle Mysteries: Giant World, Masks and Mirrors
6 New Oracle’s Curses: Claimed, Entranced, One-Handed, Halo, Stonehearted, Voiceless
1 New Archetype: Ironwood Oracle

203508.name: LOKA: League of Keepers Allysium
203508.description:
You are a man or a woman, in a fairly simple ammunition. The game begins in a small hangar and you are an ordinary mercenary in the arsenal which only has a simple shotgun, he took the part in small operations to earn money first.

Source: The Game Website.

203509.name: Planet Driller
203509.description:
Planet Driller is a mining game where you need to find DarkMatter in order to save the earth. To do this, drill your way through a procedurally generated planet full of minerals that you can sell for cash, then use the cash to upgrade your ship and make the job a lot easier!

Source: The Developer Website.

203510.name: Section 46 Operations Manual
203510.description:
[Publisher Blurb]

"Three days in that hallway hardly moving. He came up the stairs to the apartment like he knew I'd be waiting. And then he was dead. I cleaned up fast and cleared out. Not a bad job even if I say so myself. Gepetto was right. I have the ZATO documentation and the artefact specs. I'll drop them in the usual place."

The line between spy and criminal is often so thin as to be invisible.

A good spy needs to lie convincingly, break into places he or she doesn't belong, forge documents, steal secrets, blackmail potential informants and, when all else fails, kill with ruthless efficiency. Above all, they need to evade capture while doing all these things.

Section 46 operates even further in the shadows than most intelligence organisations. Their activities are unsanctioned, their methods brutal and their enemies sometimes inhuman.   The Section 46 Operations Manual is a handbook for World War Cthulhu: Cold War players, designed to teach them how best to succeed and survive in this murky world of 1970s espionage, or at least how to delay the inevitable for as long as possible.

203511.name: From the Ashes
203511.description:
From publisher blurb:

Death lurks among the stars, forever waiting for the unwary Player Character. From laser beams and bullets to the teeth of alien predators to the vacuum of space travel itself, death is, unfortunately, common in the far reaches of the cosmos. However, human (and alien) ingenuity pushes back at death and injury, with the constant progress of medicine. At high tech levels, deadly wounds and even death itself are no longer absolute: medicine can repair a broken body, replacing dead flesh and bone with plastic and steel, or alternatively re-growing dead tissues with advanced bio-medicine. This booklet details advanced technologies, from trauma medicine and trauma surgery available even at lower tech levels, to cyborg conversion replacing body parts with bio-mechanical systems and defying death, to advanced bio regeneration capable of bringing the death back from the very maw of death.

This product includes:

Trauma surgery and recovering from deadly wounds - at a price!
Less forgiving injury during character generation!
Critical hits on personnel with gruesome effects!
Cheat death by becoming a cyborg!
Build yourself a new body with Bio-Regeneration!

203512.name: Cepheus Engine System Reference Document
203512.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Cepheus Engine System Reference Document comprises the core rules for a Classic Era Science Fiction 2D6-Based Open Gaming System. Inspired by the original three books of the oldest 2D6-based science fiction roleplaying game, the Cepheus Engine system incorporates elements of Open Game Content from previous releases of that game of intergalactic drifters and wanderers to create a basic system that will allow players and Referees alike to create their own science fiction universes or play in the ones they are already familiar with.

You'll find the core essence of your favorite sci-fi game here. You can explore interstellar space, make a ton of Credits on speculative trade, find yourself halfway across the sector after a serious misjump, or blow people up with your mind, if you can find training. You can even die during character creation. This stand-alone manuscript provides all the rules you need to play the game. The Cepheus Engine rules were intentionally designed to integrate well with other 2D6-based science fiction gaming systems, especially your favorite Classic Era modules and supplements. All of the material in the Cepheus Engine rules is considered Open Game Content.

203513.name: Heralds of the Apocalypse
203513.description:
From publisher blurb:

Get Good at Being Bad!

Whether you are a GM looking for some options for a campaign's Big Bad Evil Guy, a player in an evil-themed adventure (or a whole set of adventures), or the lone evil PC in a group that likes to live dangerously, this book is ready to give you ways for your character to be evil AND fun. Because no one knows evil like the Four Horsemen!

After a brief discussion of evil in its many flavors, they get right into evil options. Evil traits allow your character to have walked the dark path of a betrayal-steeped confidence artist, violent road of a leg-breaker, or have been the immoral problem fixer as a cleaner. New feats let you spread humiliating rumors, use blood sacrifice in place of costly spell components, or just devote yourself to one of the Heralds of the Apocalypse. Archetypes for evil themes allow characters to begin the path to lichdom, make music from tortured screams for the delight of dark patrons, become a daemon knight, and much, much more!

The seals are broken, and the last horns have sounded. Come see, the Heralds of the Apocalypse are here!

203514.name: Kung-Fu Kuma: Isle of the Sun Races
203514.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kung Fu Kuma: Races of the Islands is an expansion book for the Kung Fu Kuma campaign world and the Pathfinder Game System ™. It expands the list of available PC races by 6, and it further includes 1 companion race (for use as friends, allies, loyal servants, and henchman, as well as NPCs). That's 7 new races available for Kung Fu Kuma campaigns, 6 of them directly for use as Player Characters.

One thing about all of these races, they are all Animal Folk. That is a given in the campaign world of Kung Fu Kuma. But if you purchased this book intending it for use in a different campaign world, all of these races are compatible with the general Pathfinder Game System ™, though the Gamemaster will themselves have to come up with some reason why Animal Folk exist in that campaign world.

6 New PC Races

Not many people live out in the islands to the east, south, and southeast of Qiu Sang. And of those that do, most are Humans. Not all, though. A wide variety of Animal Folk make their lives out amongst the islands.

For one reason or another, a number of Animal Folk races live solely out in the barbarian lands, ignoring the safety and civilization of Qiu Sang. This races book details seven Animal Folk races who are important amongst the barbarian tribes, six of them available as PC races. Many more races than that exist amongst the jungles and plains of the barbarian lands, but these seven are the ones most encountered when traversing barbarian lands.

Because these are barbarian races, PCs of these races are going to be restricted from taking the 12 Clans classes of Qiu Sang. As barbarians, and likely proud of their heritage, they will be taking levels in barbarian classes alone. It is a part of the price one pays for living apart from Qiu Sang.

1 New Companion Races

For some, the concept of Companion Races might be entirely new. A Companion Race is a race that is close to the PC Races in power and ability, but that is not intended for use as PCs; instead, they are intended to be used as companions.

But what is a companion? Well: aides, stewards, servants, allies, and henchmen – these are the main roles for Companion Races. A Companion Race is a race that could be a PC race, but for one reason or another, they don't have that special something that makes them ideal adventurers. And so, when they do become involved in adventures, they mostly play a support role.

To put that in game terms: a Companion Race is a race for characters that the Player may haves some limited control over, but which are not themselves PCs. In a world about Animal Folk, these races add a little bit more color to the world that would not otherwise be there.

203515.name: Infinite Threats 10
203515.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kung Fu Kuma: Races of the Islands is an expansion book for the Kung Fu Kuma campaign world and the Pathfinder Game System ™. It expands the list of available PC races by 6, and it further includes 1 companion race (for use as friends, allies, loyal servants, and henchman, as well as NPCs). That's 7 new races available for Kung Fu Kuma campaigns, 6 of them directly for use as Player Characters.

And so, when they do become involved in adventures, they mostly play a support role.

To put that in game terms: a Companion Race is a race for characters that the Player may haves some limited control over, but which are not themselves PCs. In a world about Animal Folk, these races add a little bit more color to the world that would not otherwise be there.

203516.name: Goetics and Gnostics
203516.description:
From publisher blurb:

NEW CLASSES FOR YOUR OLD SCHOOL CAMPAIGN!

RANDOM TABLES TO PRODUCE OVER 288,000 DIFFERENT QLIPPOTHIC DEMONS!

Black Box Books Tome Seven: Goetics and Gnostics

Ever want to FIGHT, WEAR ARMOR, and CAST ARCANE SPELLS? Don't want to be an ELF? I can't BLAME you. So, all you have to do is risk LIFE and SOUL as a GOETIC MAGE!

Or maybe you're MORE INTERESTED in DIVINE POWER, SLOW and SAFE? For taking the LESS COMMON path of the GNOSTIC PRIEST, you can SHRUG OFF rival magics!

OR perhaps you want to FLEE the POWER of QLIPPOTHIC ENTITIES, who wish all to be STILL, SILENT, and GRAY? There are HUNDREDS OF THOUSANDS of these Qlippothic things, thanks to COMPACT yet MIND-TWISTING TABLES! How would YOU react to a DEMON made of SALT CRYSTALS with an EXPOSED BRAIN that LAYS EGGS in your MEMORIES?!

IVANHOE UNBOUND is PROUD to present TWO NEW CLASSES and A QLIPPOTHIC DEMON GENERATION SYSTEM for SWORDS AND WIZARDRY WHITEBOX or ANY OTHER OLD SCHOOL GAME based on or compatible with the 1974 three booklet version of the WORLD-FAMOUS RPG whose name rhymes with "TRUNCHEONS AND FLAGONS!"

AND SPEAKING OF BOOKLETS, this supplement comes in POCKETMOD FORMAT. Print out a SINGLE PIECE OF PAPER which can be TRANSFORMED with FOLDS and a single cut into a TINY EIGHT PAGE BOOKLET with EVERYTHING YOU NEED to use this material in your OSR game!

Plus, while THE TINY BOOKLET IS ADORABLE, there's also a larger-size version so you can KILL MORE TREES!

And as a SPECIAL BONUS, the actual supplement doesn't use EXCESSIVE CAPITAL LETTERS!

203517.name: The Uncommon Commoners #1-7: The Uncommon Collection
203517.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Uncommon Collection collects all seven Uncommon Commoner adventures into one convenient…collection. In this semi-epic campaign, the uncommon commoners will fulfill their destiny. Or die trying. Or both—if their destiny is to die trying.

203518.name: In The Company of Fey (5E)
203518.description:
From publisher blurb:

You know you want to play a Satyr, a Sprite, or a Quickling!

Come and delight in the mess you make of mortal lives!

The First Folk, servants of Auberyon the Solstice King, they are race of mercurial essence and yet they are timeless, a race that cares very little for the consequences of their actions yet they keep the bargains that they make. They are the uncaring eldritch powers of nature, yet they are quick to take offense, all the while living with abandonment. They value entertainment, humor, and take on the aspects of various forms throughout their immortal existence.

Create the fey you want to play in the 5th Edition of the World's Most Popular Fantasy Roleplaying Game. This product includes the new fey race the First Folk, racial traits, the paragon racial class (that lets you advance as a fey), and fey feats. All so you can play fey alongside any other player character in any high fantasy campaign setting.

203519.name: Monster Treasure Hoard
203519.description:
From publisher blurb:

Too often, “standard treasure” gets eliminated because the ‘final room’ contains all the goodies, and the other monsters get none! Hoarded treasure consists of valuable goods that a monster possesses that is not necessarily used by them as legal tender, that is, for the purposes of commerce.

Within this tome you will find 10 sets of hoard treasure for CR 1/4 to CR 20.

203520.name: Tinkering 302: Modules - Tinker Magic Items
203520.description:
From publisher blurb:

Well, it only took three-and-a-half years.

Interjection Games is proud to present the latest expansion for the tinker base class: modules! The tinker base class is, and always has been, a sandbox of experimentation; however, given the tinker has such a unique method of play, the magic items made available to pretty much everyone else really don't do much for him. As a result, as a party grows in wealth, the tinker begins to fall behind in power. Tinkering 302 seeks to correct for this with modules, a new type of magic item that cheats automaton blueprint limits by virtue of simply not having a build point cost. With modules, a tinker can finally turn gold into a linear power increase for his automatons, culminating in a theoretical 61 BP of inventions on a single gigadroid automaton.

Contents

The Craft Module feat
4 new innovations
4 new greater innovations
14 modules with 25 specific variants

203521.name: Only Human
203521.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Victims for the Demon Lord!

Of all the ancestries available for play in Shadow of the Demon Lord, humans are described as the most numerous and diverse. They are also the easiest to understand. The main rulebook presents everything you need to create a human character for the game with enough variation from the human tables to make each character distinct. However, Rûl is a big place and it encompasses many variations of humans based on ethnicity, political allegiance, religious beliefs, and more. Only Human expands on the human entry by providing you with more details about how humans fit into the world, and offers new tables to help you develop human characters with incredible detail.

203522.name: Zip
203522.description:
User Summary

Zip is a game where you control a robot. You move in 8 directions and try to destroy targets with the robots laser. The goal of the game is to score as many points as possible.

203523.name: Grand National Victory: A New Game
203523.description:
This post Civil War spin-and-move game is notable both for its historical value and its sales technique. The board has a track of 100 circles starting at Washington and ending in victory at Richmond. The game requires a 1-8 spinner, and players use toy soldiers as tokens.

Each circle is marked with a battle, place, person or unit that took part in the Civil War. Some spaces are setbacks (Bull Run at 20 sends a player back to Washington), while the Andersonville and Libbey prison spaces traps a player until another player reaches a prisoner exchange space.

The back of the board both describes the game and shows how it was sold. A veteran soldier "or his agent" would leave a game card on doorsteps for residents to play freely, and then would "call in the morning for 10 cents, as it is earnestly hoped you will patronize", signed "A Boy in Blue". The rest of the back features the words to the patriotic song "We Saved the Union for You".

203524.name: Rebound (1982)
203524.description:
User Summary

Rebound is an arcade game in which you attempt to bounce a ball into as many targets as you can within the time limit.

203525.name: The Parent Quiz
boardgamepodcastepisode: 48 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Restaurant Games
203525.description:
"The After Dinner Family Trivia Game"

Includes 50 trivia cards with a blank space in each answer block for you to enter your own answer (the questions are about you). Ask the question to your family, the person who correctly guesses gets to keep the card (one point). Highest point total wins.

203526.name: Break
203526.description:
User Summary

Break is a variant of Breakout. You move a paddle along the bottom and bounce a ball off of it in an attempt to break all the blocks at the top.

203528.name: Slide
203528.description:
User Summary

Slide is a game where you prevent falling rocks from dropping off the bottom of the screen with paddles. Similar to Breakout except the rocks do not bounce.

203529.name: Clone!
203529.description:
User Summary

Clone! is a game where you are banished to a mine. You walk around and collect fuel to score points. In each level there are also bad guys who chase you and you must outrun.

203530.name: Krypto
203530.description:
User Summary

Krypto is a math card game. The deck has 52 cards with two sets of 0 to 25 numbers. You are dealt 5 and must use all five to recreate the target number using addition subtraction multiplication and division.

203531.name: Contact (1982)
203531.description:
User Summary

Contact is a dice rolling game. Played with 6 dice your goal is to score 5000 points in a turn. The dice make up what are essentially Yahtzee combinations.

203532.name: Drone!
203532.description:
User Summary

In the game the player takes control of a drone airplane and must attack the enemy.

203533.name: It Starts With a Boat
203533.description:
From publisher blurb:

The horns of war have been sounded and the united armies of the pegasi and the griffons stand ready to launch a battle across the sea to reclaim the stolen weather magic from the elves. Will you stand with them, to serve as their forward scouts and pave the way to victory? Or will you fail and see this effort doomed from the start, the final death throes of the ponies' significance.

An adventure that starts at level 1 and ends into level 3 and follows the steps through this war of many battles.

This adventure is made to scale for a party as small as three or as large as six. It's set in the world of Everglow, but standard PCs (humans, dwarves, maybe not elves) can function just fine.

203534.name: Retruco
203534.description:
Retruco is described on the box as "A Game of Skill, for Winter Evenings, Playable on any Table". It also is an early example of celebrity marketing, as the box declares "Played at Warwick Castle During the Visit of H.R.H. The Prince of Wales, May 1895". The box claims "Patent No. 575".

The rules say the name is Spanish for "a recoiling" and the game consists of 9 wooden pins, 3" tall, and a wooden ring. The eight yellow pins are set up in a square and the single black pin goes in the center of the square.

Players take turns propelling the ring by pushing down from the top so that it moves forward with a reverse spin, one that brings it back toward the player if it hits a pin. A player gets three shots, plus one more for each hit. Pins are reset for each player's turn.

Hitting a pin scores 10 for those in the rank nearest to him, 20 points for those on either side of the black "king" pin, and 40 points for those in the far rank. Hitting the "king", however, wipes out his score and ends his turn. First player to reach 500 wins.

203535.name: White Text on Black Cards
203535.description:
White Text on Black Cards was designed from the despair and despise of seeing and being asked to play all of the variants of white text on black card games. Now when I am asked to play such games, I can play this as an alternative and in just one quick round! After that, your group can easily move onto a better game of any type -- just not these!

The game is played in one round. It begins with you laying the one black card on the table and dealing the white cards as evenly as possible to all players. Then players choose the best response to the one black card and hand the to you. As the person who started the game you get to decide which answer is the best for that moment and the player who chose it gets a point. The game is played as many times as you like and points are tallied and scored most points wins.

203536.name: Monkey Mountain
203536.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sexy princess stolen by a giant ape into a forbidding jungle forest. It all feels quite familiar and yet - isn't that the ape whose face is on the wrapper of those fruit pies you love so much? You kind of hope it isn't. Those things are tasty!

Nothing ever is as it seems in the land of Thule.

Monkey Mountain is a mini-adventure made for use with the Crimson Dragon Slayer RPG, an old school swords & sorcery system featuring an elaborate world trapped inside a Commodore 64. The adventure itself is for 2 to 4 players running character levels 3 to 5.

203537.name: Danger Zone
203537.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Adventure Continues!

Beyond Monkey Mountain and into the scorching hot desert of the north, in search of strange alien robots known as Zynjas with the hope of unwravelling a mystery found inside one of their stainless steel skulls.

Looming off in the distance, just across the badlands, stands a giant dome of inpenetrable darkness known only as the Big Black. Like an ocean-sized bubble of tar rising off the land, no one knows what it contains and few who go in ever return. Emanating from within its sheer wall of darkness has been heard the sounds of machines. Giant cranking clanging machines. And explosions. A non-stop 80's action movie of explosions.

How can you resist?

Danger Zone is an adventure made for use with the Crimson Dragon Slayer RPG, an old school swords & sorcery game featuring an elaborate world trapped inside a Commodore 64. The adventure itself is for 2 to 4 players running character levels 4 to 6.

Bring extras.

203538.name: Count Orlok
203538.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Power behind the Vampire Throne

Count Orlok has sought dominion of the world through vampire slaves since the second century AD. In the 1400s, he turned hundreds by promising immune to the Black Death. When imprisoned by the power of the Church, he still managed to gain influence through an agent named Vlad. When Van Helsing foiled those plans, Orlok was forced to forge a new apprentice in the person of British nobleman Jonathan Howlett, who he eventually sent to curry favor as the Nazi super being “Nachtoter.” When that intermediary was struck down by Pendragon, Orlok simply faded back into the shadows, and began his next plan…

Iconic Legends. Because sometimes you a need a character everyone knows, even if they're meeting them for the first time.

203539.name: The Horde
203539.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rise of the Horde

Following the downfall of Nazi Germany, Thule Society and the Reichslowen reformed themselves into a subversive organization focused on world domination. Under the leadership of Junker (PL 9), The Horde was one of the most feared and powerful collection of terrorists in history.

Years later UN forces began to track down the operatives of the Horde. Intelligence services sought out Horde infiltrators in the ranks of the military and politics. And in 1965, a UN strike force stormed the Horde's island headquarters, killing the majority of the leadership. It was believed that the Horde was destroyed ...

Super Powered Legends. Because sometimes what you need is a character everyone will recognize, even if they’ve never met her before.

203540.name: Mimic
203540.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ruin character class for use with Basic-based Fantasy RPGs.

203541.name: Protean Scribe
203541.description:
From publisher blurb:

To a protean scribe, all the universe is formed of words. Not just words such as the kind in a language spoken by mortals or even by the gods themselves, but words more powerful even than that. Words that drew forth the universe itself from the protean mass of chaos that came before. Protean scribes dedicate their lives to unearthing these primordial words, and to weaving them into common languages to create powerful magical effects; empowering their allies, weakening their foes, or even creating life with nothing more than a simple stylus and a few words.

Inside this sourcebook you will find you’ll need to enhance on adventures when using the Protean Scribe base class:

All the information to play the Protean Scribe as base class for the Pathfinder RPG and NeoExodus: A House Divided Campaign Setting.
Rules for the Protean Scribe’ Stylus and Writing including to create three distinct types of fantastic effects -- Embellishments, Phrases and Stories; and Primordal words.
Five All New Archetypes: Scrollblade, Wordwriter, Censor, Runewriter and Orator.
Six New Feats including Distant Phrase, Evolved Story, Intense Phrase

203542.description:
Description from the publisher:

At the Horribilorum Sorcery Academy for Witty Witches and Wizards, we are not afraid of ghosts! Potion Explosion: The Fifth Ingredient introduces a new spooky ingredient: Ghost Ectoplasm! But don't panic as the new Professors will teach you how to handle it safely and use it to brew powerful new potions!

This expansion for Potion Explosion steps up the game to a whole new level! Thanks to the fifth ingredient acting as a joker, players can now trigger even more incredible explosions to prepare their potions. Four new potions allow for even more diverse gameplay!

On top of this, new Professors dramatically change the way of brewing potions!
203542.name: Potion Explosion: The Fifth Ingredient
boardgamepodcastepisode: Anticipazioni Essen SPIEL 2016 – Il Dado Incantato #10

203543.name: Tavern Kit 2
203543.description:
The Tavern Kit was one of Ennead Games first generation of products. It was released in several parts, covering the name and symbol, the features of the tavern and much more.

Now, taking the information contained in the multi-part kit it has been combined, expanded in some places and generally tidied up to make a better more useful product.

In this updated & compiled Tavern Kit you’ll find:


A system for creating the name of the tavern and deciding on its sign & symbol
The features of the tavern – What are the walls like, the floors, the doors, how many rooms does it have etc.
The internal details, such as any decoration, smells and sounds you may encounter
Quirks, features or secrets about the tavern
Tables to help flesh out the owners, staff and any patrons drinking and eating in the tavern
Need to come up with a menu for the tavern or decide what type of drink they are serving? Worry no longer
What accommodation or other services does the tavern provide
What happens to anyone who gets a bit too merry and drunk…..


Please note that if you have the original Tavern Kit, most of the information you have from that will be in here.

- Publisher's description

203544.name: Betrayal's Tower
203544.description:
From the publisher:
A long time ago an ancient curse was origined into The Forbidden Tower. Palia's Guardians, The Elementals, sacrificed their existence to seal up the curse inside the Tower. Over time the seal has become weaker and The Curse is about to be released. A new generation of heroes will must have to put an end to the terror that threatens the kingdom. But, everything is not as easy as it seems... Among the heroes there is a traitor who will have to get rid of the heroes and release The Curse.

Betrayal 's Tower is a team game aimed at any follower of the fantasy genre in which you will have go up through the tower floor by floor, beating the danger it hides inside. You must defeat monsters, buy powerful items, and use special abilites of each heroes to reach the top of the tower and destroy The Curse to win and avoid the end of the kingdom.

From the publisher (Spanish):
Tiempo atrás una antigua maldición se originó en la Torre Prohibida. Los guardianes de Palia, los Elementales, sacrificaron su existencia para sellarla en el interior de la Torre. Con el paso del tiempo el sello ha ido debilitándose y la Maldición está a punto de ser liberada. Será una nueva generación de héroes quienes tendrán el deber de poner fin al terror que se cierne sobre el reino. Pero no todo es tan sencillo como parece, entre los héroes hay un traidor que tratará de sabotear la misión y lograr así liberar la maldición.

Betrayal’s Tower es un juego de equipo dirigido a cualquier seguidor del género fantástico en el que tendréis que ascender por las peligrosas salas de la torre prohibida y enfrentar los peligros que aguardan. Deberéis derrotar monstruos, comprar poderosos objetos y usar las habilidades únicas de cada héroe para ganar y evitar así el fin del reino.

203545.name: Pong! (1982)
203545.description:
User Summary

Pong! Is a collection of three pong style games. tennis, hockey, and squash and features a practice mode.

Tennis is similar to regular Pong, while squash has both players on the same side of the firld. Hockey gives both players two paddles. One for Offense and one or Defense.

203546.name: Skeet!
203546.description:
User Summary

Skeet is a clay pigeon shooting game. One button launches a pigeon and another attempts to shoot it.

203548.name: The Pursuit Card Game
203548.description:
"Ever since you became aware of that laptop, and the stolen data held within it, you have been caught up in a dangerous game of cat and mouse. The company, from whom the data has been stolen, are offering a substantial reward for return of their laptop; a reward some people are willing to kill for.
If you are to stay alive, you will need rely on the support of emergency services, acquire weapons to protect yourself, and hope that your mysterious guardian angel is watching over you.
So find the laptop and keep hold of it until the end of the day to claim your reward"

The Pursuit, is a fast paced card game for which is best with 3 or more players, but can be played with 2 people.
Players will take it in turns to draw a card, or play a card, trying to acquire the Target Card (a laptop containing stolen data). Once a player has possession of the Target Card they will soon discover that keeping hold of it is a different challenge as their opponents steal, and attack, to gain the advantage.

203549.name: Qenj
203549.description:
The goal of Qenj is to align 4 different color pieces on a same plank.
The pieces can move 1, 2 or 3 planks away in the left-right direction and the player may place them on any empty arrow of the destination plank.

Some other rules must be followed :

There can't be several pieces of the same color on a plank.
The players must move pieces that are on the closest arrow to them.
Empty planks are removed from the game entirely.

203550.name: A Dark Design
203550.description:
From the Introduction:

As the pathway to darkness stretches forth, a vile mentor begins his dark designs.

User summary:

For a party of 2nd - 3rd level characters.

203551.name: Little Shrine of Horrors
203551.description:
From the Introduction:

The party are drinking and gaming at the Gambling Golem in Longsaddle, when someone spots the following message pinned to the notice board -


Wanted: Tomb raiders!
Those seeking high adventure and a fabulous fortune should apply to - Gunther Grimm, Esq.
Room 12 at the Gilded Horseshoe


User summary:

For a party of 4th - 5th level characters.

203552.name: Doldrums and Delays: Options for Downtime
203552.description:
From the introduction:

Most of the game of Dungeons and Dragons is focused on the interactions with the things in its name; places of danger and intrigue and creatures that threaten individuals and entire populations. In short; adventures. The many details of life outside this slice of interest are often ignored as much as possible, being less interesting and important as well as far too prone to the fiddly details which turn D&D into Accountants and Actuaries.

Yet, there are always those players who want downtime. The individuals who want to research a new spell, craft a new weapon, set up an inn, tavern, or other business, or otherwise use their hard-won wealth on something other than the adventuring life. Perhaps leaving a mark in the world. Sometimes these periods happen because the DM says so; perhaps they feel the kingdom and world cannot always be at risk and the party cannot always have an immediate lead on a new source of untold wealth and glory. Sometimes downtime is the result of a real world intermission. The days, weeks, and months where real life overtakes players being reflected in the game itself.

For whatever reason downtime happens, this book exists to make it more interesting. These optional rules and options can make the choice between lifestyles mean something more than how much gold is removed from the characters’ pockets. It certainly gives characters, even those “wild souls” who chafe at the idea of inactivity, intriguing choices to make in how they spend their non-adventuring time. For downtime effects, this means adding some risk and reward to the choice of lifestyle. Do you choose the cheaper, but more dangerous route, or the more expensive and safe route? Regardless, life has some inherent risks and on some level all adventurers are looking for their next grand tale.

Meanwhile, downtime actions are about giving characters and players something the character wants that they cannot gain through adventuring alone. Perhaps they simply wish to spend their enforced stillness preparing for their next adventure directly. Alternately, for those who recognize that spellcasters are not the only individuals who need magical items as they progress and question the wisdom of relying on the random detritus lost by their forebears; rules are provided to give the opportunity for noble knights to forge blades of legend. Even the most savage or ignoble members of a party have more intuitive and primal ways to weave of the forces of destiny into enchantments for their equipment.

203553.name: Neon Space Ultra
203553.description:
User Summary

Space Invaders clone with some extra explosions of colour.

203554.name: The Darklake Strikes Back
203554.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome back intrepid Underdark adventurers! Journey Through the Center of the Underdark 2 - The Darklake Strikes Back contains several more encounters meant to flesh out your days spent traversing the underdark. This time we're on the vast and varied waters of the Darklake, where the Kua Toa are Kua Toa and the fish are frightened.
...
Readers unfamiliar with Out of the Abyss or the Underdark of the Forgotten Realms are likely unaware of the existence of the Darklake, so an explanation is in order. The Darklake is the name given to a massive interconnected underground body of water hundreds of miles across that flows through all manner of Underdark tunnels. Gargantuan vaults of unfathomable size and depth, narrow maze like tunnels and broad water filled passages are some examples of the varied chambers in which this body of water resides.

203555.name: The Book of Forests
203555.description:
A Compendium of Creatures, Magic, and Spells from the Forest

From the introduction:

The Book of Forests is designed for Dungeon Masters (DMs) who desire to extend their campaigns under the eaves of mighty and ancient forests.

Herein you will find a variety of creatures, both goodly and foul, that grace the forests of the fantasy world. Many of these have special connections to elves and elven communities, while others represent malevolent manifestations of trees. The creatures are of a variety of challenge ratings, though they tend to skew towards being adequate challenges for low- to mid- level PCs.

In addition to a large number of new creatures, this book contains just over a dozen magic items that relate to elves or the forest. Many of these items can only be utilized by elves, half-elves, or druids.

Finally, six spells are presented that relate to nature and forests.

203556.name: Wizard's Tower
203556.description:
From publisher blurb:

A System Neutral Edition GM's Resource by Creighton Broadhurst, Ronald Calbick, Seamus Conneely, Taylor Hubler and Anthony Jennings

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. Compiled from the free 20 Things posts available at Raging Swan’s website, this short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation. This instalment provides ten tables designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the looting a dead body or slain foe.

20 Things #3: Wizard’s Tower comprises the following 20 Things articles, along with other supplementary material:

20 Minor Magical Effects to Encounter in a Wizard’s Tower
20 Spell Components to Discover in a Wizard’s Tower
20 Things to Decorate a Wizard’s Tower
20 Things to Find in a Necromancer’s Sanctum
20 Things to Find on a Wizard’s Bookshelf
20 Things to Find in a Wizard’s Laboratory

203557.name: Wizard in a Bottle
rpgissuearticle: The Best of the Dungeon Masters Guild
203557.description:
From the introduction:

The party are in Neverwinter looking for adventure and fortune. Through an acquaintance, they have arranged to meet a man named Ulfgar Longwood at the Bridgeside Coffee House. They’ve been told he has a proposal for them.

Ulfgar turns out to be a round, graying man with a missing leg. He greets the PCs with an enormous grin.

User summary:

For 2nd - 3rd level characters.

203558.name: Drake Windchaser
203558.description:
From publisher blurb:

Save People! Hunt Things!

An all-new product line by Everyman Gaming, LLC, Everyman Iconics takes one of the recurring characters illustrated throughout Everyman Gaming’s library of products and provides information about the character like never before, including a detailed backstory, a full 20-level character build, and stat blocks for GMs and players to use the Iconic at every level of play. Within, you’ll find the following:

Drake Windchaser, Everyman Gaming’s iconic Human Gunslinger / Ranger.
Includes a detailed character gazetteer, featuring Drake’s vital statistics and character history.
A full, easy-to-reference 20-level character build for Drake Windchaser including full information on his classes (gunslinger/ranger), archetypes (pistolero and monster hunter), feats, character traits, and ranger spells.
Seven stat blocks designed to allow GMs to use Drake Windchaser as an NPC in their campaigns. Includes stats for Drake at 1st, 3rd, 7th, 10th, 13th, 17th, and 20th levels.
Three pregenerated character sheets that allow GMs to hand a 1st, 3rd, or 7th-level version of Drake to a player for quickly playing the Everyman Iconic as a PC on the fly.

203559.name: The Warlock
203559.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are ancient and endless beings of power at work behind the scenes. They work through proxies, engaged in a war where no matter who wins, humankind loses.

You know what they say. If you can't beat them, join them.

Enter into a pact with one of these eldritch patrons, whose only command is "obey" and whose only price is "souls". In exchange, it will lend you the power you crave. Dark secrets, terrible curses, writhing minions, and more will respond to your beck and call.

Bring these gifts to bear against your enemies quickly, lest your patron's appetite turns towards you for the ultimate sustenance.

The Warlock is a class playbook for use with the Dungeon World roleplaying game. It is meant to complement the existing class playbooks, while providing an alternative for players who want to try an arcane class that relies on otherworldly patrons for power.

This product includes:

A 2 page ready-to-print class playbook PDF
A 14 page full class PDF in the style of the Dungeon World core book

boardgamehonor: 2016 Diana Jones Award for Excellence in Gaming Nominee
203560.description:
From the publisher:

"Magic is dying, and the Magus is dying with it. We travel together to the realm of Umbra where magic was born."

Fall of Magic is a game of collaborative storytelling where we play a group of travelers in the company of the Magus. The game follows a literary tradition of the fantasy journey where the character’s relationships, transformations, and experiences take center stage.

The game features an elegant rule set and stunning presentation including a canvas scroll which unrolls as we travel, revealing perilous roads, strange hosts, and fantastic locales. The scroll is over 5’ (1.5m) in length and is masterfully illustrated by award-winning artist Doug Keith.
203560.name: Fall of Magic

203561.name: Voz
203561.description:
User Summary

Voz is a chess based puzzle game. You are shown a board with several hidden pieces on it and it is up to you to guess which piece is which.

203562.name: Handlist of Horrors
203562.description:
From publisher blurb:

55 NEW CREATURES FOR YOUR OLD SCHOOL CAMPAIGN!

Black Box Books

Tome Eight: Handlist of Horrors

This is a long list of tiny seeds for creature creation, with suggested hit dice levels and a suggested method for calculating all the other statistics from that hit dice level.

Here's a QUICK SAMPLING:

ABACUS JELLY: Gelatinous blue dodecahedron studded with lit vacuum tubes. Houses a sorcerer’s soul.

EPHIALODAEMON: 6’ tall mantis with the head of human infant. Voice like a castrato.

GATAKAIROS: A patchwork combination of a gecko and jaguar made from the skin of a dead god.

PNO-IRA-KAA: Giant head that sleeps furiously and explodes in a thousand poppy flowers when awakened.

TAROT CARACAL: A lion with a single wooden wheel instead of legs. It eats only the heads of its victims.

ZIZYPHON: Divine carnivorous bush. Emits infrared light. Cool to touch. Creates miracles for any who feed it.

And that's only a SAMPLING!

IVANHOE UNBOUND is PROUD to present FIFTY FIVE MONSTERS for SWORDS AND WIZARDRY WHITEBOX or ANY OTHER OLD SCHOOL GAME based on or compatible with the 1974 three booklet version of the WORLD-FAMOUS RPG whose name rhymes with "TRUNCHEONS AND FLAGONS!"

203563.name: The Miser's House
203563.description:
User Summary

The Miser's House is a text adventure game where you explore a house and solve puzzles.

203564.name: Five Year Mission
203564.description:
From publisher blurb:

Compatible with both White Star: White Box Science Fiction Roleplaying and Swords and Wizardry WhiteBox! Also, quite easy to use with ANY old school game based on a game whose name rhymes with "Truncheons and Flagons!"

This is a supplement for White Star with a sort of Star Trek theme. If you're a fan of Star Trek, Andromeda, or Farscape, and even if you're not, there's a lot for you to like here!

What do you get?

FIVE (5) new classes: Engineer, Expendable, Guerilla, Sawbones, and Scientist, as well as additional notes on the core classes from White Star!
FOUR (4) new racial classes: Disgraced, Living Starship, Quixoitic Alien, and Simulacrum!
NEW EQUIPMENT that you can requisition, including weapons with a "stun" setting and badge communicators!
FOUR (4) new starships and THREE (3) new starship modifications, including the Quantum Teleporter!
NINETEEN (19) new NPC alien races, including a table to randomly determine the appearance of your own aliens!
SIX (6) random tables for space exploration! HEXCRAWLS... IN... SPAAAAACE!
A complete setting in TWO (2) different eras, THE CONTESTED ZONE!




What are you waiting for? You can afford it. Treat yourself before the utopian post-scarcity economy kicks in!

203565.name: Duel!
203565.description:
User Summary

Duel! is a two player board game. Each player has a number of pieces and one king. The goal is to eliminate the other players king or to move your own king into the other king's starting position.

203566.name: Emaze!
203566.description:
User Summary

Emaze is a game taking place in a rapidly changing maze. The goal is to find the exit of the maze within a time limit.

203567.name: Attack!
203567.description:
User Summary

Attack finds the player defending a castle from thieves trying to steal a trasure. You move around the castle firing your weapon at attackers who are trying to tear down walls making it easier for future waves to get to your treasure. But you can also repair walls as long as they are still standing somewhat.

203568.name: Crypts & Creatures Players Codex: Book One
203568.description:
From publisher blurb:

Let the Options begin!

Have you ever needed more options than just another dwarven fighter or elven wizard in your party?With the Players Codex you can have the edge that you need to enjoy your Crypts & Creatures game like never before. New races, new classes, specialized equipment, spells, and magic (and a few psionic) items.

Psionics is the ultimate equalizer when handling supernatural powers. Some say that it rivals magic! No more bulky spellbooks, strange arcane components or obscure incantations. Psionic powers reside in the mind, just waiting for the right manifester to come forward and claim their prize; whether it's the Psion – with their six specialty Disciplines, Psychic Warriors – the perfect mix of metal and mind, or Wilders – with powerful Wild Surges.

Magic Items... sometimes they have make of break an adventuring party. Need a portable castle? A staff to teleport your party to the Orik Desert? How about a gauntlet to that helps your Paladin of Alladar heal better? All of these problems can be solved with the right magic item.

Within these pages you'll find:

Fifteen new races, including: psionic races, Half-Ogres, Lizardman, Tieflings, Aasimars, and many more!
Seven new classes (Anti-Paladin, Oracle, Thaumaturgist, Gunslinger, Psion, Wilder, and Psychic Warrior).
Vehicles and Airships, including the ZS-3100 and the Century Eagle.
New Skill (Concentration).
Psicrystals (psionic familiars).
Psionic Powers & Items.
Two optional rules (Heroism and Multi-class).
More detailed rules for magic/psionic item creation (using the Crypts & Creatures system).
36 unique magic items.
2 unique psionic items.
Over ten new spells.

203569.name: Safe!
203569.description:
User Summary

Safe! Is a game is safe cracking. You are attempting to decipher a 4 digit safe combination and crack the safe within the time limit.

203570.name: Ram
203570.description:
User Summary

Ram is a two player board game where players try to cross the board with one of their pieces. Each player has a number of pieces which are stackable. The distance you may move is the same as the height of the stack, If your stack encounters a smaller enemy stack that stack is removed from play.

203571.name: Tank! (1981)
203571.description:
User Summary

Tank is a two player game where each player controls a tank in a top down view. Your goal is to eliminate the other player's tanks using missiles and miles.

203572.name: Lawn!
203572.description:
User Summary

Lawn! is a lawn mower simulation. You control a motorized lawnmower and must try to mow the entire lawn before fuel runs out to win.

203573.name: Wormskin (No. 3 - Summer 2016)
rpgissuearticle: Of Men, Goats, and Fairies in Dolmenwood
The Ruined Abbey of St Clewd, Level One: Surface Ruins
The Summer Stones and the Witching Ring
The Woods East of Lake Longmere
203573.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wormskin explores the mythic forest called Dolmenwood, a weird folklore setting for use with B/X or similar tabletop adventure games. Each issue uncovers various elements of this eldritch realm situated on the leafy verges of Fairy, where austere Drunes rub elbows with weird elf-lords and talking beasts, where witches wander skyclad and armed with sinister magicks to bind the spirits of hapless adventurers. Be wary.

Issue 3 includes:

An overview of the history of men, goats, and fairies in Dolmenwood since ancient times. Who is the Cold Prince?
Details of the most commonly spoken languages in the setting.
A description of the ley-line Chell, a ring of occult energy encircling a 60-mile area of western Dolmenwood. Its origin, powers, and purpose are revealed.
Encounters and points of interest in seven hexes to the east of Lake Longmere, in the heart of the wood.
The first level of a dungeon central to the history of Dolmenwood: the ruined abbey of St Clewd.
Four new monsters: gloams, mogglewomps, scrabies, and scryckes.

203574.name: Maxit
203574.description:
User Summary

Maxit is a strategy game for two or one vs AI. There is an 8x8 board and each space has a point value. You try to earn points by moving one of your markers to a space to collect however many points are there. However the first player is only allowed to move horizontally and the second vertically.

203575.name: Emergence Roleplaying Game Core Rulebook (Special Edition)
203575.description:
From publisher blurb:

Emergence is an exciting, easy-to-learn roleplaying game that takes place on the Earth-like world of Kython.

Emergence blends elements your favorite games into a single cohesive setting. The heart of the game world mostly resembles that of modern earth, but as you venture away from this comfortable and familiar center, different genre components shift in prominence. High fantasy, sci-fi, horror, dark science, occult, and post apocalyptic settings all shine through in the final vision of the world.

Through this interplay of genres you can insert all the fantastical elements that make you love roleplaying games, into a world that you already know. This eliminates most of the learning curve of the setting, allowing you and your group to get into the action faster.

Mechanically, Emergence is as rich and varied as the setting in which it takes place. Emergence places a high value on player choice. You can customize nearly every facet of your character, along with his gear, vehicles, mounts and body. Below are some of the options and features included in the Core Rulebook and that make Emergence the game you and your group will love for years to come:


Determine all rolls through a simple system using only three six-sided dice
Engage in an exciting, fast-moving combat system that encourages immersion and creative thinking
Gain a broad knowledge of Kython through background information for dozens of locales and governments
Create a unique racial makeup by combining elements of the four player races from a pool of over 50 racial traits
Represent your base experiences through 16 character backgrounds
Use diverse and broad skills to specialize while maintaining a sense of versatility
Construct incredibly diverse characters using specialized abilities from 33 talent trees and over 650 talents and benefits
Customize your equipment and vehicles through systems that allow thousands of combinations
Forge your body and spirit into whatever you can imagine using four complete systems for Augmentation — Cybernetics, Fleshweaving, Runescribing, and Magic Items
Garner advice and rules for creating environments, quests, adventures, and campaigns in the Game Mastering chapter
Create opponents and character companions using quick, simple rules that also allow for virtually unlimited combinations and possibilities


So grab some friends and some dice, and bring your imaginations………. Adventure Awaits!!!

This special edition of the book contains an extra, extended portion of the Inner demons short story and is printed in premium quality.

203576.name: The Vile Witch
203576.description:
From publisher blurb:

On the fringes of the civilized world lie things wishing for the way things were... before. In the dark days prior to the dawn of the humanoid races, it was kill or be killed. And survival of the fittest was the only rule of law. Back then, the shadows swelled with terrifying beasts using anything they could to spread the taint of fear to every dark corner.

Those things are still out there. Plotting. Planning. Scheming. Struggling to find a foothold in the light of day.

From that darkness, Vile Witches have emerged to spread their particularly nasty form of corruption to the world. And they have come to stay... They may live in the refuse of a civilized world, but they are far from powerless.

The Vile Witch is the first new class for Mazes & Perils - a nasty new spellcaster out to spread their particular brand of sickness to those who cross their paths. Vile Witches or Warlocks have the power to make your PCs want to see their local healer and bathe regularly!!

This 14-page supplement (9 pages of content) offers a fully formed class you can play as a PC or NPC in a Mazes & Perils campaign - complete with new abilities, nearly 20 spells, and rules for Familiars you can use with other wizard classes as well.

She is only the first of a few new classes we have planned for M&P, so keep an eye out to see what else we have in store for you to play with!

203577.name: Command
203577.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spell Power: Command includes a handful of new feats for fans of the command and greater command spell, plus plot hooks to bring your adventurers in quickly using this spell and these feats!

Feats include Cowering Command, Gluttonous Command, Kneeling Command, Screaming Command, Squirming Command and Weeping Command! The plot hooks wrapped around command and greater command include a maze of deadly traps, a dangerous zealot, a twisted wand of greater command, and assassins who use command spells!

203578.name: The Thaumaturge
203578.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Thaumaturge is a new take on magic for your OSR compatible game!

Bored of the certainty of Vancian magic? Want your magicians to act more like the magicians of fiction and lore, where magic is risky and requires the caster to actually use time and tools to increase their chance of success? Then the thaumaturge is for you!

A complete 20 level class compatible with any OSR game, the thaumaturge replaces the standard magic-user. Their magic is difficult to use, often time consuming and inconvenient, but dripping with flavor. A bad roll can have disasterous consequences, while a good one can cause tremendously potent results.

Learn any spell of any level you can find, but will you be able to cast such complex magic or will you destroy yourself and your allies in the attempt?

Also included are 6 new magic items and 2 new spells to use with the class.

203579.name: The Delectable Dragonfly (A Tea House Twist) (Pathfinder Edition)
203579.description:
From publisher blurb:

When your PCs are ready to scrub all the monster blood and layers of grime off their smelly adventuring bodies, they might be ready to take in an afternoon at the local tea house, that is, if they can handle all the gossip and back stabbing that goes on in a place where the notable ladies of the city gather to unwind and decompress.

Tangible Taverns: The Delectable Dragonfly (A Tea House Twist) details a tea house and spa; fancy food, a variety of teas, and pampering body treatments await the guests of this fine establishment. With several staff, numerous wives of notables about town, and a few characters with mysterious pasts, there are a host of NPCs ready to interact with the PCs and add a little role-playing fun to your game session.

This PDF includes rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and descriptions of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities, as well as a few stat blocks).

203580.name: Tea House Caper (Pathfinder)
203580.description:
From publisher blurb:

Desperate to get a family heirloom back, Edwin Scrumple hires the PCs to infiltrate the local tea house, a place frequented by notable ladies of the city who spend their time gossiping and backstabbing as they sip cups of tea. Can the PCs get the heirloom without attracting attention? Or will they draw the eyes of the manager Prim, or worse, incite the wrath of their target, a bitter sour-faced woman whose words cut as deep as a warrior’s sword?

Tea House Caper is designed to accompany Tangible Taverns: Delectable Dragonfly (A Tea House Twist) and is suitable for four 3rd to 4th level characters.

203581.name: Ultimate Fey Guide
203581.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagine a land where fantastic beings dwell. Imagine a land where grand adventures await. Imagine a land where perils and magic reside together. Now imagine this land is next to our own, but its entrance can only be seen by those who know of its secrets. This land is the Fey Realm.

The Ultimate Fey Guide is a sourcebook for Savage Worlds that presents a micro setting set in the fantastical land of the Fey Realm. This micro setting can be used to build your own fantasy setting or set alongside an existing setting to form a multiverse or incorporate the fantastical themes of the Fey Realm.

Ultimate Fey Guide includes:

A brief history of the Fey Realm.
Important locations within the Fey Realm.
Seven fantasy player character races including: brownie, dryad, nyad, and sprite.
New Edges, Hindrances, and Equipment.
A collection of fantasy creatures for your Fey Realm adventures.
... and more!

203582.name: All the Strange, Strange Creatures Volume I
203582.description:
From publisher blurb:

‘There's a horror movie called Alien ? That’s really offensive. No wonder everyone keeps invading you!’

For much of our history humans have gazed up at the stars and asked the question: are we alone in the universe? The answer, of course, is no! The galaxy is teeming with life. Aliens populate every corner of the universe, and many have visited our humble little planet.

All the Strange, Strange Creatures is aliens. Aliens the Doctor has encountered on his adventures. Aliens he has not yet met. Aliens he hopes to never meet again. This supplement provides the Gamemaster with the details of just some of the alien races that the Doctor has encountered, from Daleks and Cybermen to the Vashta Nerada and the Skovox Blitzer.

As well as providing rules and background for each of the aliens included, this supplement also gets beneath the skin of each of them. What makes them tick? What do they do? How do you use them in your adventures? What sort of stories do they appear in? What else might you do with them? And how do you go about making up your own aliens?

203583.name: Expanded World Generation
203583.description:
From publisher blurb:

This rule supplement provides several expanded rules for more varied and nuanced world generation in Stars Without Number, from taking into account the atmosphere's and biosphere's influence on the world's population to a plethora of new and expanded world tags.

Included are:

Expanded generation tables for atmosphere, temperature, biosphere, population, and tech level.
Expanded interaction between the various world characteristics, such as the atmosphere's influence on population or the population size's influence on the tech level.
14 new World Tags.
Two examples of expanded world generation.

203584.name: Los Tesoros del Rey Pirata
203584.description:
The Pirate King is gone. Now the most seasoned crews sail the seas in search of the buried booty. Who will be crowned as the new Pirate King or Queen? Who will sink in the cruel storm of bullets and blades?

In Los Tesoros del Rey Pirata ("Treasures of the Pirate King") the players are pirates collecting treasure cards which will grant points. The pirate with most point wins the game and is named the new Pirate King or Queen.

The board has 12 islands in a 5x7 grid. 3 map cards will show which of these islands the players can go to claim the treasures. In their turn, players can also fight each other in duels, to steal treasures, and opening fire, to steal cards from their hand. There’s also treason cards that can be used to mess other player’s plans but these can be countered with protection cards.

The main mechanism is that most actions require a number. Dice imprinted in the cards are used to assign this number to be assign. The die used can be chosen from a card from the hand, therefor be a known number, or use the first card from the deck and be a random one. Cards used as a die are discarded and don’t have additional effects.

203585.name: Temple of Healing
203585.description:
From the introduction:

Ahead of you is a large temple. The limestone walls are heavily weathered and show scars of ancient battles. You see a multitude of stained glass windows depicting mythical and historical figures.

User summary:

A potential adventure for low level characters; probably best used as a support locale, however.

203586.name: The Raven
203586.description:
From the introduction:

The Bloodhand orcs have a prisoner that may hold the answers to the strange goings on and the key to stopping the enemy. What can you do to convince them to hand the prisoner over?

Part Twelve of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A Two-Hour Adventure for 5th-10th Level Characters.

203587.name: The Horseman
203587.description:
From the introduction:

An unknown force is inciting the people and creatures of the idyllic Greenhall to commit horrific acts of murder and carnage. Can the adventurers quell the towering rage of the rampaging Horseman?

Part Thirteen of Misty Fortunes and Empty Hearts.

A 2-Hour Adventure for 5th-10th Level Characters

203588.name: The Dark Lord
203588.description:
From the introduction:

The enemy is revealed, but time [is] short and if you are not successful in your mission to Mount Baratok, love will never die.

Part fourteen and the finale of Misty Fortunes and Absent Hearts.

A four-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters

203589.name: Simple Percent System
203589.description:
User summary:

This rules-light game uses percentile dice (exclusively) to determine the outcomes of all actions. Character creation is simple, with an archetype, a feature, and skills. All of these are selected by the player at character creation. Skills have a numeric value that is randomly determined.

Although the system is entirely generic/universal, all of the samples are based in a fantasy genre.

203590.name: Single Page Game System
203590.description:
User summary:

This rules-light system uses a single 3d6 dice roll to determine all opposed actions. The roll is summed and compared to a difficulty determined by the game master. The rules do allow for modifications to the roll, but they are not common. Character creation involves selecting a few narrative tags. Characters have a single variable attribute called Destiny.

203591.name: Rescue!
203591.description:
User Summary

Rescue! is a game of space rescue. Shuttles enter the screen from the top and using your keyboard you try and guide the shuttle to a safe landing spot.

203592.name: Defend!
203592.description:
User Summary

Defend! Is a shooter game where targets come on screen in four different directions. You shoot the respective target by hitting the direction on your key pad. Each shot costs energy and each missed target costs you some of your shield.

203593.name: Racer! (1981)
203593.description:
User Summary

Racer! is a top down racing game. The game has randomized tracks and you can input the difficulty to widen or narrow the track, and add potholes. You have four controls total gas, brake, and left/right.

203594.name: G-Word
203594.description:
User Summary

G-Word is a combination of Hangman and Mastermind. You have to guess a word the computer has chosen. Each turn you get to guess fice letters and the computer tells you how many are present in the word but not which letters.

203595.name: Ambush!
203595.description:
User Summary

Ambush! is a two player turn based strategy game. Both players move around a grid to adjacent tiles and then choose a tile to bomb. The first player who is surrounded by bombed tiles loses.

203596.name: Enigma (1980)
203596.description:
User Summary

Enigma is a simulation if the encryption used by Germans from the 1920's to the end of WW2. You are allowed to set the encryption to custom settings if you wish.

In order to decrypt the messages you use a separate key provided.

203597.name: Sol Invictus
203597.description:
From the game manual:

In Sol Invictus players take on the roles of United Nations Military soldiers. It is the year 2164. Having traveled aboard massive spacecraft in cryogenic suspension, these marines are faced with a star system filled with hostile alien psychics.

User summary:

The game setting is exceptionally detailed; the game rules are not as refined as the setting.

203598.name: Mwhiz!
203598.description:
User Summary

Mwhiz! us a two player educational game. Arithmetic functions are shown on screen and must be quickly judged as true or false with faster answers scoring more points.

203599.name: Background & Details Kit 2: Fantasy Edition
203599.description:
In 2012, the original Backgrounds and Details Kit from Ennead Games was released. Now, several years later, it has been remade, with more options and the original set of details expanded on and improved. Combining this publication with content from others that have been made over the years and new features added the BDK 2 was made. Designed for both players who want to flesh out their character and GMs that wish to make an NPC that little bit more believable.

This publication is divided into multiple parts; quick, detailed and life events.

The quick section is for when you want just the basics. It covers the characters age range, their gender, species, profession and personality - Make an NPC with only a few rolls.

Detailed is when you want more details for your characters or NPCs or to help flesh out an existing characters background. You may need a flaw, a secret or just can’t decide what colour the characters hair is. You probably won’t be using all these details on one character at once. This section gives you hair style, skin, friends & family, fears/phobias, motivations and much more.

Life events cover major events in the characters life, from birth, through adulthood and method of death, if needed.

When using theses tables, especially the detailed background ones, you may get what appears to be conflicting results. But don’t despair or re-roll these results as some of the most interesting characters can come from what appears to be conflicting information.

Inside you find tables for...


Character hometown details
Eyes details and other facial features
Parents details
Phobias and how character reacts to their phobia
Professions
Skin type/condition
Species
Typical clothing
Voice style and type


and many more!

- Publisher's description

203600.name: Match (1980)
203600.description:
User Summary

Math is a game similar to Concentration. The twist is that instead of finding two identical pictures on a grid you must find two cars whose sum equals 63.

203601.name: Spectra
203601.description:
From the introduction:

Like many fantasy worlds Spectra is pseudo‐medieval in feel, chivalrous Knights protect the week and fight for their lords, scholarly wizards study in their towers, Orcs, Goblins and other foul humanoids lurk on the edges of civilisation and Dragons, Ogres and Giants are known to terrorize towns and villages form time to time.

The driving force that pervades all aspects of life and culture on Spectra, though, are the Colours. The six Colours determine things like personality, ideology, virtues, vices and motivations on both a personal level and a societal one.

203602.name: Thunt!
203602.description:
User Summary

Thunt! is a game where you are searching a maze for a treasure. Enemies roam the maze and kill you if you touch them. After deciphering where the treasure is you must make your way to a randomly generated exit.

203604.name: SCORE
203604.description:
SCORE, is a Sport and Profession Driven Open World Multiplayer Game where players compete for fame, glory and wealth on a global scale on and off the pitch.

Source: The Game Website.

203605.description: Enjoy this 24″ x 14″ slip-resistant neoprene gaming mat to give your intergalactic conquest a smooth feel. It features the Activation Bay, Planet spots and is great to roll dice on. Look out for the Achievement list also!
203605.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Playmat

203606.description: Enjoy this 24″ x 14″ slip-resistant neoprene gaming mat. You will be able to place your territories and immerse yourself in the fight.
203606.name: Tiny Epic Defenders: Playmat

203607.description: Enjoy this 9.5″ x 8.5″ slip-resistant neoprene Tower and Action card replacement mat so you can conquer the Kingdom in style.
203607.name: Tiny Epic Kingdoms: Action / Tower Playmat

203608.name: Strangers of Fiction
203608.description:
From the user:

In the game, Characters are defined by ten Attributes. Five of them are traditional Attributes - the other five are combat Attributes, somewhat atypical from derived values found in most games. Action resolution uses a d6 dice pool, with 1's and 6's exploding into a second roll with possibly bad or good results, respectively. The game is designed to utilize a variety of genres, possibly at the same time.

203609.name: The Hope
203609.description:
From the introduction:

The players must face the Fear that dwells in the dark corners, who seeks to extinguish all Hope from our world. Characters can even travel to Fear's dark dominion, The Darkness, in order to save the innocent lost boys and girls trapped there. Enjoy!

User summary:

Although the game is about childhood, it's not for children. The game document has a subtle but striking presentation. The game document includes a print-and-play character sheet.

203610.name: Theosis
203610.description:
From the introduction:

Karus, the Prophet King has ruled now, unopposed, for a century, using his strange powers to sustain and empower his failing body. As the practice of magic has spread, magic itself seems to have steadily grown in power. Likewise, the formerly legendary and now factual magical creatures have become common place despite the Church hunting them with tireless fanaticism.

While the Church is mighty, and its reach is far, every year, more and more of these mages are slipping through the cracks.

It is only a matter of time before the rising tide of chaos and war threatens to drown the world of Purgatory. The question becomes, what then will be the aftermath… heaven, or hell?

203611.name: The Sound of Aliens
203611.description:
User summary:

The pre-generated characters in The Sound of Aliens are defined by distinct abilities and an "Advantage Dice" pool. They are derived from the game's inspirational films - Aliens and The Sound of Music. The game's setting is a hysterically bizarre mash up of both films, featuring high tech weapons, Nazis, harmonizing, geopolitics, and Aliens... oh my!

203612.name: Kraven Manor
203612.description:
Turn out the lights, take a deep breath, and prepare yourself. Explore the depths of the immersive, atmospheric world of Kraven Manor. Uncover its secrets, solve its mystical puzzles, and face the growing threat within.

Kraven Manor challenges you to explore an expansive manor and discover the mysteries that lurk in its dark corners. You have the power to dynamically alter the layout of your environment by interacting with a miniature scale model of the manor, located in its extravagant entryway.

Dynamically build the manor around you. Find miniature room models and carry them back to an increasingly elaborate scale model of the manor. Adjusting the model causes rooms to move and appear in real space, awaiting your arrival.

Each new room exposes revelations into the troubling past of William Kraven. Face your fears and see if you have what it takes...the doors of Kraven Manor await you.

Source: The Game Website.

203613.name: The Token System
203613.description:
From the introduction:

The game is played by a group of players, who each take the role of a character, and a single game-manager, who presents scenarios, obstacles, and opponents for the players to interact with. Each character has a pool of resources, represented with tokens, which are used to determine the success and effects of actions taken throughout the game. These tokens represent an intrinsic quality; they cannot be traded between characters. The game-manager also has a pool of tokens to oppose the characters' attempted actions. The sizes of these token pools fluctuate during the course of the game, but return to their starting numbers at the start of each game-session.

203614.name: Tournament Grounds
203614.description:
Welcome to Tournament Grounds! This is not a simple tournament. This is not a tournament for heroes who wish to spend their days talking to kings and dealing with the affairs of state. This tournament is about power, about grind. It’s about killing as many of your enemies as you can before you run out of lives. If you squeeze every last bit of potential from your abilities, you might survive this tournament.
...
Tournament Grounds is a game for experienced GMs and players who wish they could dig through old character sheets and use those heroes of days’ past in an epic struggle to determine who wins.
