203615.name: Zombie Attack
203615.description:
User summary:

Zombie Attack characters are defined by two traits selected from a list of three. Characters may improve with experience. The core game presents a relatively brief "scenario" comprised of a series of zombie attacks on the character(s). The game is designed for solitaire play only.

203616.name: Rift
203616.description:
Rift is an arena-battle style game that unites fast-paced action with strategic card management.

An idyllic world is just one of many in the cosmos - until the Rift appears. Manifesting as a magical tear in space-time, the Rift contains the promise of absolute power - and total destruction. Up to four immortal warriors arrive on the planet to claim the Rift as their own, even as the energy begins to tear the world apart. The storms, volcanos, and earthquakes that the Rift creates are fair game to the immortals, who use the disasters to power their attacks against each other. Only one will be left standing to claim the Rift as their own.

Rift is a streamlined dueling system, where the cards in a player's hand simultaneously represents their life total and their options. Damage taken forces a player to discard, leading to agonizing choices as the game reaches its world-shattering conclusion. The novel, unique rule-set is both quick to pick up and features near-endless strategic depth.

203617.name: Sables
203617.description:
User summary:

Characters in the game are definied by Attributes (Domination, Echoes, Flair, Forge, Psyche, and Reality) and Skills. Action resolution uses a modified dice roll compared to a target difficulty. Characters spend some time in the "real" world and some time in the drugged Morph world, experiencing hyperrealistic dreams constructed by thousands of interconnected dreamers.

203618.name: Techniques d'Interrogation a l'Usage des Agents de la Fonction Publique de la Glorieuse Republique Populaire de Strana
rpg: Techniques d'Interrogation a l'Usage des Agents de la Fonction Publique de la Glorieuse Republique Populaire de Strana
203618.description:
User summary:

The game is for exactly two players. The characters enact a phased series of interrogations during which one player, The Staff, attempts to determine whether or not the other player, The Suspect, is or has been politically suspect. In cases of even minor doubt, The Suspect is guilty. Thus, the game definitively presents a power imbalance during play. The situation largely evolves through play, however, so if clever, The Suspect can prevail. But it's not easy.

203619.name: WWF Royal Rumble (2000)
203619.description:
WWF Royal Rumble is a professional wrestling video game released in 2000 for arcades and the Dreamcast. THQ published the title for the Dreamcast while Sega released it for arcades. It is based on the World Wrestling Federation professional wrestling promotion and its yearly Royal Rumble event. Yuke's, creators of the WWF SmackDown! series developed Royal Rumble, which had several unique features including support for up to nine wrestlers on the screen simultaneously.
Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/WWF_Royal_Rumble_(2000_video...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

203620.name: Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Six (unofficial expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
203620.description:
From the publisher:

Volume Six of the unofficial 3rd-party expansion to the hit party game Cards Against Humanity.

Here in the VSC labs, we've been hard at work for the last year, attempting to isolate a new set of cards with--theoretically--unlimited laughter potential. I'll admit, things were touch and go there for a while, between the betrayal of Dr. Weisen and her acolytes, and the mysterious "accident" that took the life of Mr. Slowpokes, our office sloth.

...But every tragedy begets a triumph, and so we are proud to introduce Crabs Adjust Humidity: Volume Six. Fresh from the smoking wreckage of Testing Bay Three, we bring you another deck of 112 cards so vile and morally-bankrupt, someone may try to elect it president.
Includes: 80 white cards, 32 black cards
Professionally printed on linen-finish, casino-quality cards.
100% compatible with Cards Against Humanity.
Custom serialized hologram on every box, so you know you're not getting a counterfeit.
Has no real moral compass.
Do not refrigerate after opening.

203621.name: Cocks Abreast Hostility: Cock Pack Two – Fowls Deep
203621.description:
100 "White" Cards
25 "Black" Cards
Traditional black and white card backs
Seamlessly playable with official cards
Not part of a balanced breakfast

Cock Pack Two: Fowls Deep

Card fronts appear in "Fair Use Blue" and "Copyright Compliant Navy", while card backs are traditional black and white, making them playable with other card games with similar initials.
Nearly 100% of the proceeds from every purchase will be converted into either single malt Scotch or small-batch Bourbon.

203622.name: Pharaoh Code
203622.description:
Will you be able to solve the Pharaoh Code ?
Won the education award issued by the Ministry of Education Culture, Sports and
Tourism in Korea, strongly recommended!
Pharaoh Code is a math puzzle game with dice and tiles. Players are trying to find
high-scoring solutions using numbers from two or three of the dice. Pharaoh Code
is a fast-paced family game with easy rules. And it’s also a great educational game
to help children increase their mathematical skills while having fun.

你能否解開法老密碼？
法獲韓國文化體育觀光部頒發教育獎，大力推薦！
法老密碼是一款以骰子和數字牌組成的數學謎題遊戲。玩家需要嘗試以兩顆
或三顆骰子，組合最高分數的答案便可取勝。法老密碼是一款規則簡單，遊
戲節奏快的家庭遊戲，它兼具教育性，不單讓小朋友快樂地遊戲，同時增進
數學知識。

203624.description:
As soon as a coin in the coffer rings, the soul from purgatory springs" —Johann Tetzel, 1465-1519

Mea Culpa is a paradise-and-pandemonium gamer's game that’s all about sins and sinners. Be it at the brothel or at the market, men such as the Pope or the Emperor can be seen hard at work at any time of the day. Even the most miserable miser, though, would be well advised to also strive to get hold of enough precious stones and wine to make sufficient donations towards the Lord's cathedrals. After all, it is through pious generosity that a poor soul can gain the all-important letters of indulgence and be pardoned for a life of greed and lust. When all is said done, what matters is to have sinned just enough to have achieved all goals and gotten away with it, while others took the fall.

In more detail, to win, players have to end the game with their "poor souls" closer to heaven's gate than their opponents. Alas, throughout the game these poor souls pretty much exclusively move in the opposite direction, i.e., towards Hell. Only at the very end of the game might players climb back towards heaven, depending on the letters of indulgence that they managed to collect up to that point.

The accumulation of these letters of indulgence is each player's primary goal. To this end, they take on the roles of different people: the Pope, the Emperor, the Merchant, or the Little Sinner. Each round, these roles in turn grant them access to different special actions. On their turn, players buy or sell goods on the market, visit the brothel to benefit from personal connections, or secretly donate money and goods to the church. Meanwhile, the construction of the game's three cathedrals proceeds. As soon as a cathedral is fully erected, the church will hand out the all-important letters of indulgence. However, only those who have donated the most in either of three categories will actually receive anything.

Many perks that can be used during the game require the players to "sin". Sins are tracked by means of a tally stick and will move the player's poor soul closer to hell. The player who strikes the right balance and picks the right roles at the right time will be able to collect the most valuable letters of indulgence and might stand chance at winning the game. If a player has burdened themselves with too much sin, though, all will ultimately be for naught.
203624.name: Mea Culpa
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 10: Meer Essen

boardgameintegration: Table Air Combat: B-17F Flying Fortress
Table Air Combat: Flight Operations Manual
Table Air Combat: B-17F Flying Fortress
Table Air Combat: Flight Operations Manual
203627.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface. All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters. Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.
Each player has a flight of four fighters, represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.
Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.
TAC is designed for portability: the entire game can fit in a plastic bag. Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately. This set contains the Me-262 Schwalbe, the first jet fighter used in combat.

Scenarios include:
•Dogfight: A flight of Me-262 fighters goes head-to-head with a flight of P-51D Mustangs
•Bomber Interception: Assisted by Bf-109G fighters, Me-262s attack a formation of B-17F bombers and their P-51D escorts.
•Vulched: A low-flying Me-262 is preparing to land when ambushed by a roving P-47D fighter.
203627.name: Table Air Combat: Me-262 Schwalbe

203628.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Emma Frost
203628.description:
From the publisher:

Emma Frost, once a supervillain and foe of the X-Men as part of the Hellfire Club, she has evolved to becoming a superhero and after joining them is one of the X-Men's most powerful members and a leader to the superhero group and an alternative love interest to Cyclops. She is a mutant with an enormous telepathic ability, which she uses to read the minds of her opponents and communicate with her team. But she can also transform into a diamond state or form, which provides her with enhanced strength and almost indestructible durability, but suppresses her telepathic abilities.

203629.name: Boswain
203629.description:
User Summary

Boswain takes place after you have fallen into a trap door and are locked inside. The Boswain shows up and will release you if you find him ten rubies.

203630.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Gambit
203630.description:
From the publisher:

A member of the mutant hero team the X-men, Gambit has the ability to mentally create, control, and manipulate pure kinetic energy. He is also incredibly knowledgeable and skilled in card-throwing, hand-to-hand combat, and the use of a staff. Gambit is known to charge playing cards with that energy and other objects and use them as explosive projectiles.

203631.name: Ouranos!
203631.description:
User Summary

Ouranos! is a classic aiming artillery style game. It is different though because each player is launching weather in the form of rain, hail, tonadoes, and lighting, at the other players shack.

203632.name: Capture!
203632.description:
User Summary

Capture! is a puzzle game where you try to capture wild beasts in traps by surrounding them with boxes.

203633.name: Drag
203633.description:
User Summary

Drag is an educational drag racing game. Players attempt to quickly solve math problems to progress their car down a drag strip the fastest.

boardgameintegration: DC Universe Miniature Game: Batman V Superman Trinity Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Guardians of the Galaxy Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Avengers Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Dark Avengers Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: X-Men Starter Set
DC Universe Miniature Game: Batman V Superman Trinity Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Guardians of the Galaxy Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Avengers Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: The Dark Avengers Starter Set
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: X-Men Starter Set
203634.description:
From the publisher:

This game is a small scale skirmish level game where Superheroes and Villains face off against each other in a 3D tabletop set up. It could be a city, the Wakandan desert, the Savage Lands, the blue area of the moon or anything you like. In Marvel they fight anywhere.
It is played on a 36" x 36" board so will fit on most tables without a problem.

In a game you will usually have between 4-7 characters on your team. Each of these characters act individually using their own Power to carry out different attacks and use Special Powers.
Many can help or hinder each others though with boosts and actions like a Fastball Special.

The aim of the game is to win set scenarios by completing different tasks and scoring Victory Points. These could be anything from take down / save the highest Level model in the team or rescue and keep a Cosmic Relic.

Each character comes with their own Stat Card which shows everything they can do. Attacks, Defence, Skills, Power, Damage and such.
These are then used in a 2 D8 mechanic during the game. For example, 2D8 plus Attack Stat vs Defence Stat or 2D8 against your own Agility.

Magneto formed The Brotherhood of Mutants as a group dedicated to the cause of mutant superiority over humans. Throughout its various incarnations, the Brotherhood's agenda has gravitated towards either subjugating the human race to the will of mutants or eradicating humanity altogether.
203634.name: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Brotherhood of Evil Mutants Starter Set
boardgameaccessory: Marvel Universe Miniature Game: Spray Template
Marvel Universe Miniature Game: X-Men Markers

203635.name: Godzilla!
203635.description:
User Summary

Godzilla! Is a turn based strategy game played out on a grid. On your turn you can move your units around the map, attack Godzilla, and even authorize an atomic strike against him.

The game ends when you kill Godzilla or Godzilla destroys Japan.

203636.name: Rail
203636.description:
User Summary

Rail puts you in charge of a railway circuit with the goal of properly changing switches to lead trains to destinations. If trains collide or a train hits a bad switch you lose.

203637.name: Frog!
203637.description:
User Summary

Frog puts you in control of a frog trying to eat buts to survive. You control the frogs mouth and tongue and attempt to catch flies out of the air. You lose if the frog uses up all of his energy (calories.)

203638.name: Sheep
203638.description:
User Summary

In Sheep you are attempting to round up a herd of sheep before they eat all of your crops.

203639.name: Joust (1980)
203639.description:
User Summary

Joust is a Jousting game for two players. Players control the location of their shields and lances attempting block the other players lance with their shield and get their lance to connect with the other player.

203640.name: Police!
203640.description:
User Summary

Police! allows you to play as a police officer first trying to locate a perp and then trying to actually catch him using road blocks. The game is played on a top down map.

203641.name: Ruler
203641.description:
User Summary

In Ruler the player is presented with a virtual ruler and asked to mark off certain lengths. Points are scored based on how close you were to the correct length.

203642.name: Aliens!
203642.description:
User Summary

Aliens! is a shooter similar to space invaders. This game however spawns ships for you to shoot infinitely until you die.

203643.name: Nab!
203643.description:
User Summary

Nab! is a game similar to Pac-man. The game board however is a + shape and there is only one AI enemy trying to catch you.

203644.name: Fire!
203644.description:
User Summary

Fire! is a firefighting simulation putting you in charge of a helicopter dousing buildings with water from above.

You win by putting all fire out or lose if you fail to do so within 3 minutes.

203645.name: Everest
203645.description:
User Summary

Everest is a mountain climbing game in which you try to climb Mt. Everest. You climb the mountain buy hitting corresponding numbers shown up the side of the mountain. You lost if you run out of energy.

203646.name: Bat!
203646.description:
User Summary

Bat! allows you to control a bat attempting to stay alive by eating insects. Different bugs have different energy values and some are actually bad for you. The game ends when you run out of energy.

203647.name: Raft-Away River
203647.description:
User Summary

Raft-Away River is a co-op game taking place on the banks of a river following a rafting accident. The only way out is by raft so you must try to build a new raft while also worrying about food and shelter.

203648.name: WarWizard
203648.description:
User Summary

WarWizard is a medieval fantasy RPG. You are the WarWizard a character skilled in combat and magic. You build up a party and acquire new skills on your path to defeating a Dark Warzard.

203649.name: Acey Deucy
203649.description:
User Summary

Acey Deucy is a gambling game. You are shown two face up cards and a third face down. The goal of the game is to place a bet on whether the face down card is between the two face up cards or not.

203650.name: Acigol
203650.description:
User Summary

Acigol is a puzzle game where you try and decipher the rules behind a series of light switches with the ultimate goal of having all the light switches On.

203651.name: Acrobat II
203651.description:
User Summary

Acrobat II is a Breakout style game where you are launching a person off of a see-saw and trying to pop balloons that are above instead of trying to knock out blocks.

203652.name: Star Battle (1981)
203652.description:
User Summary

Star Battle is a game based on Galaxian. The player controls a ship at the bottom of the screen that can be moved left and right while shooting at aliens near the top of the screen.

203653.name: Money Wars
203653.description:
User Summary

In money wars you are a robber tasked with retrieving and delivering bags of money without getting shot. The game is a side scroller.

203654.name: Air Attack
203654.description:
User Summary

Air attack is played by dropping bombs onto blocks below you in an attempt to shorten mountains so your plane will not crash into them.

203655.description:
Timeline: Polska is a card game played using 110 cards. Each card depicts a historical event from Polish history on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.
203655.name: Timeline: Polska

203656.name: 5th Edition Background Generator
203656.description:
From publisher blurb:

Thousands of New Background Options for 5th Edition.

If you want a background that perfectly fits your character, look no further than the 5th Edition Background Generator. Using the rules in this sourcebook, you can mix and match twenty new and variant background features with hundreds of language, proficiency, and suggested characteristic options, including lists of new traits and flaws specifically tailored to fit your character's skill and tool proficiencies.

Hand pick the options you want or generate a custom background entirely at random. Start from scratch or modify an existing background to better fit your character. The 5th Edition Background Generator has everything you need to create the background you want for your character, including dozens of sample backgrounds, from bandits and courtesans to templars and vigilantes.

Whether you're looking for a background that fits a specific theme or simply looking for inspiration, the 5th Edition Background Generator has you covered.

203657.name: The Delectable Dragonfly (A Tea House Twist) (System Neutral Edition)
203657.description:
From publisher blurb:

When your PCs are ready to scrub all the monster blood and layers of grime off their smelly adventuring bodies, they might be ready to take in an afternoon at the local tea house, that is, if they can handle all the gossip and back stabbing that goes on in a place where the notable ladies of the city gather to unwind and decompress.

Tangible Taverns: The Delectable Dragonfly (A Tea House Twist) details a tea house and spa; fancy food, a variety of teas, and pampering body treatments await the guests of this fine establishment. With several staff, numerous wives of notables about town, and a few characters with mysterious pasts, there are a host of NPCs ready to interact with the PCs and add a little role-playing fun to your game session.

This PDF includes rumour and event tables, a tavern map, and descriptions of frequent faces about the establishment (which include names, physical features and personalities).

Take a break from combat and add a little role-playing to the evening with a Tangible Tavern.

203658.name: Elementalry: Ectoplasm Elementals
203658.description:
From publisher blurb:

Just in from the Ethereal Plane, its Elementalry: Ectoplasm Elementals!

Featuring an all-new full set of spooky, slimy elementals who can literally slap you into another plane of existence!

Plus a new Ectoplasmic alternate sorcerer bloodline, the new corporealize and ectoplasmic body spells, and an ectoplasmic expansion for elemental body.

203659.name: Gravaton (M&M3)
203659.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Adrian Lerner was THAT guy. He was the one who walked around the lab as though he was superior to everyone and he loved pointing it out. That changed the day a lab accident produced wonderful powers to control gravity. Unfortunately, having powers reinforced his belief that he was superior. He will now prove it to the world unless your heroes can stop him.

203660.name: Chicago 90
203660.description:
Chicago 90 is an action/racing game developed by Microïds in 1989 which provides two game modes: one can play both gangsters and policemen with two different goals and strategies. In the "gangsters mode", you simply have to escape the city while avoiding the cops. In the "police mode", you have to control six police cars in order to prevent the gangster from escaping the city and arrest him. Those two modes give some diversity to the game although its expectancy is a little short.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago_90 Chicago 90]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

203661.name: Bad People
203661.description:
Find out what your friends really think about you in this hilarious and brutal voting game!

Each turn one of the players is the Dictator and reads a question card out loud. They then silently vote for one of the other players who they feel fits the question best. All other players then vote for who they think the Dictator choose, if they are correct they earn a point.

First person to 7 points win.

203662.name: The Book of Ages (1997)
203662.description:
User summary:

The Book of Ages was published in final form as a "netbook" in 1997. It describes a setting cosmology based on an entire galaxy formed by two entities known as Guellup and Farniss. The setting introduces technology (especially interstellar travel) to the magical worlds commonly found in Advanced Dungeons & Dragons games, providing a "mash up" of space opera and high fantasy tropes. The document lists a large number of "known" worlds with various classifications.

File pagination was performed by the author.

203663.name: The Complete Guide to Alcohol
203663.description:
User summary:

Self-proclaimed as "the biggest, best, and most popular role-playing accessory on the net", The Complete Guide to Alcohol went through a lengthy development period even by netbook standards. Upon its final format in 2000, the book ran to hundreds of pages.

The book is remarkably inclusive, touching on almost every imaginable topic related to alcohol. In addition to the typical topics found in works of this nature, the netbook presented magic items, monsters, and spells dealing with alcohol in some way or another.

The final version of this book was made available in ASCII text as well as in DOC format. The book is presented with traditional game mechanics obviously aimed at AD&D 2e, though major components are suitable for use with any RPG.

203664.name: Holy Grail
203664.description:
In this cooperative dice game, players direct a team of six female Knights of the Round Table (a number of Player Knights equal to the number of players, plus enough Questing Knights to make up the remainder) on a quest to obtain the Holy Grail. Each Knight has its own special ability that may prove useful during the team's adventures.

The Knights travel a path through the countryside, rolling dice in an attempt to gain valuable items that will score points or aid in future battles. At the end of the path, the Knights must roll dice to engage a Boss Monster in combat. All the while, the Knights must contend with worldly corruption, represented by Karma tokens. Any Knight who gains too many Karma tokens is too corrupt to obtain the Holy Grail and is eliminated from the quest.

Each Boss Monster battle represents the end of one round. After 3 rounds (Easy or Normal difficulty levels) or 4 rounds (Hard difficulty level), the Knights face one final trial to obtain the Holy Grail. If any Player Knight is eliminated due to too much corruption, or if the Knights fail to defeat the final Boss Monster, the players immediately lose. If the players pass the final trial and obtain the Holy Grail, they win. Victorious players may calculate a final score based on the items and successes gained during the game.

203665.name: Senatus
203665.description:
It is 100 A.D. The present emperor is Trajan; one of Rome's greatest generals, leading Rome's greatest military expansion. He has ruled for two glorious years. The senate is largely perfunctory, but those in power still seek the Emperor's ear in order to push their own agendas. This game is about trying to gain Trajan's favor and rule Rome from the shadows.

In Senatus players are members of a secret cabal attempting to control the Senate from behind the scenes. By manipulating the system, passing Bills that improve their status, and gaining influence over the city's factions, the players gain control over various aspects of Rome. Victory points are earned by having influence over the Senate, factions, Senators, and Emperor's Favor. At the end of the game, the player with the most extensive power structure (i.e. victory points) wins.

Be warned, Politics is a bloody endeavor! You will work to usurp the control of others in factions, pass bills to help your allies and punch your foes and all the while your robe is more and more stained with the stench of corruption. Can you navigate these treacherous waters and emerge the hero of the senate?

203667.name: Down and Out in Gadding-Thoth
203667.description:
From the introduction:

Gadding’s elite are well-familiar with the lore of Thoth and its echoes throughout the world. From the Black Thothites, the seamen who escaped the drowning of Thoth and still lay claim to it, to the Thothic faith, to the ancient arts of writing and fireworks, much is owed to Thoth.

And what better way to celebrate its legacy than to explore it, kill its inhabitants and loot its treasures?

User summary:

The game uses a rotating game master role, which moves from player to player depending upon which section of the region is being explored. The game uses collaborative setting and character development. The product has unusually high production values.

A one-page "Errata" document makes a few corrections to the text; it is available as a separate download.

203669.name: The Vampyre of Mons
203669.description:
From the publisher:

The Vampyre of Mons is co-operative game of exploration, adventure and horror by Darkmook Paper Miniatures & Water Closet Press. Debuting at Thought Bubble 2015 in the UK and originally limited to only 30 copies for the initial print run, this is now available digitally as an RPGNow! exclusive!

Set in the dark days of the Great War, The Vampyre of Mons is designed for 1-6 players and sees heroic (and not so heroic!) British troops and their mysterious allies facing the horrors of the Vampyre Lord's castle, where the very building itself plots to aid in their demise!

Using the latest version of the Darkmook Paper Miniatures Survival Horror rules, all you need to do is print and construct the components, grab some 6 sided dice and a standard deck of playing cards and you are ready to start your adventure!

203670.name: Mercenaries & Magnates
203670.description:
from the introduction

Scavengers was originally designed to be played as a short campaign, giving the players the opportunity to have their character go through an entire career as a space salvager. Several of the mechanics were made to support this: the increasing amount of danger points and the speed of which the characters acquired their wealth. Still, there is nothing in the way of using the game for longer campaigns, and the core book even offers some suggestions of what game mechanics that needs to be changed to achieve this.

Nevertheless, a longer campaign dedicated only to looting can become stale and uninteresting, unless something more is offered to give it a sharper, dramatic edge. In this supplement are two extended campaigns to be used for Scavengers. Both of them increase the scope of the game, and make it better suited for longer campaigns.

The first is Magpies of War. Instead of being a regular salvager crew, the player characters are active participants in the galactic civil war. By finding important pieces of secret intelligence on shipwrecks, they can sell them to the warring factions for high profits. But they must beware, if one faction grows to strong, it may defeat the other factions, and put an end to the Randians' lucrative salvaging business.

The second campaign is Boardroom Salvagers. The PCs are not satisfied with getting rich of their salvaging, they want to be super wealthy. With the conclusion of their initial salvaging careers, the original crew forms a salvaging company, and hire employees to continue their work. In this campaign the players string together multiple characters, seeing how each of them fare in their career, how the company prospers throughout, and how powerful the original company founder can get.

Finally, this supplement offers new threats. They are intended to be used mostly with the Magpies of War campaign, since they are tied to the intelligence gathering mechanics of this campaign; but they can easily be used in any Scavengers game.

203671.name: Relicblade: Two-Player Battle Set
203671.description:
From the publisher:

"At the crossroads of salvation and supremacy brave heroes and brutal monsters clash for control of powerful magic relics, lost in the ruins of the ancient world."

In this fast paced miniatures skirmish game players customize their characters using a vast arsenal of upgrades to gain a tactical edge. Assemble a party of bold adventurers or a war band of savage Pig Men to claim your destiny in the savage realms of Relicblade!

This box contains everything two players need to play Relicblade. including two full size war parties, character cards, upgrade cards, relic cards, measurement gages, tokens, dice quick start guide, and the fully illustrated rulebook.

203673.description:
Complicated Board Game the Card Game is a simple card game about playing complicated board games. Try to best your friends as you place pieces, discover new rules, change the board, and occasionally realize you're playing an entirely different kind of game. In CBGtCG, we take the nonsense of cracking into a new board game alongside your friends and condense it into a competitive 15 minute game for 3-6 players.

The goal of the game is to be the first player to clear their Holdings of 5 random Piece cards. On a turn, each player has 2 Phase Points to spend which can be used to play Pieces on the Board or game mechanics from their hand (Rules, Board States, Events, and Win Conditions). Each Piece can be played on one other Piece in a rock-paper-scissors format. Hats are worn by Soldiers. Soldiers ride Sheep. Sheep are abducted by Spaceships. Spaceships obliterate Castles. And Castles, Hat. Board States dictate the locations that players may play their Pieces on the board. Rules add new regulations to the game that everyone must follow. Events are one-time actions that help you or hurt your friends. Win Conditions provide one player with a new, secret way to win the game.
203673.name: Complicated Board Game the Card Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 28 – The Family Gamers Podcast – Boston FIG Tabletop games

203675.name: The New and Improved Alternative Wrestling System
203675.description:
From the introduction:

Wrestling is the most basic of combat skills, unknowingly practiced by almost all children as they rough and tumble with each other. However, there exists a fine art of wrestling that only professional wrestlers use. Thus, the Alternative Wrestling System exists for those characters who are willing to spend a weapon proficiency slot to learn and master the Alternative Wrestling System.

203676.name: Star Realms: Crisis – Heroes
203676.description:
Heroes are a new type of card for your Trade Deck. When you acquire a Hero, it goes directly into play instead of into your discard pile. Then the Hero awaits your command to rally their allies and give your turn a boost.

This expansion contains 12 cards: 2 Cunning Captain, 1 Admiral Rasmussen, 2 Ram Pilot, 1 Blob Overlord, 2 War Elder, 1 High Priest Lyle, 2 Special Ops Director and 1 CEO Torres.

Source: The Publisher Website.

203677.name: Netbook of Bard Songs
203677.description:
From the introduction:

Hear Ye Hear Ye! Hereunder lies the words as told by various bards, compiled by me, Daltrin The Cheerful. Please, use the words to best thy knowledge, and further thy goals. Beware the bard who [claims] these as his own; Other than that, brave minstrel, enjoy, and may your mandolin strings never break!

User summary:

Includes numerous songs referring to various aspects of the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons game.

203678.name: The RPG Bible: Weapons
203678.description:
User summary:

This large document is a compilation of fan-created weapons of all sorts (nearly all magical, most fairly traditional weapon forms) gathered from various newsgroups, e-mail distribution lists, and other pre-World Wide Web computer resources. Most (but not all) of the items receive individual credit (usually an e-mail address or a forum username). The document has a comprehensive table of contents which is quite useful.

The document is sub-titled "Volume 1 Edition 2".

203681.name: Waterloo: l'ultima battaglia di Napoleone
203681.description: 'Waterloo: l’ultima battaglia di Napoleone' ("Waterloo: Napoleon's Last Battle") is an introductory board wargame designed by members of Casus Belli association for the association itself. The subject of the game is the famous battle between Napoleon and Wellington which took place in 1815 and caused Napoleon’s final defeat and his getting off the stage of history. The game simulates the first part of the battle, until short before the arrival of the prussian reinforcements. The limited amount of counters, the size of the map, the duration of the game and the limited amount of rules make of it a good introductory game for anyone willing to approach the world of pure board wargaming. Movement and combat take place on a classic hex grid with the use of playing cards (“Tactical” cards and “Command” cards). A high number of alternate activations by both players and the way in which cards are used contribute to “mitigate” the flaws of a classic “I go, you go” mechanism.

203683.name: The Gallery of Magical Blades
203683.description:
User summary:

Several editions / versions of The Gallery of Magical Blades circulated on various computer systems prior to the eventual "standard" Version 4.00 of the book, which included good organization and relatively complete editing and standardization. The Version 4.00 document usually was released with a two-page DOC "What's New in Version 4.00" document. Later, a Version 5 was released which added several new items but was otherwise largely unchanged.

The book, as indicated by the title, focuses exclusively on magical bladed weapons with a very heavy focus on swords.

203684.name: Peako's Book o' Cantrips
203684.description:
User summary:

Peako's Book o' Cantrips was a widely circulated but poorly organized "netbook" that enumerated numerous cantrips ("zero-level" magical spells). The book additionally provided several higher-level spells that produced various meta-magic effects when combined with cantrips (for example, "Permanency", etc.).

203685.name: The Complete Guide to Unlawful Carnal Knowledge
203685.description:
From the introduction:

This guide should not be used by anyone that the GM feels is either to young, to immature, or not a good enough role-player to handle the topics presented here.

User summary:

Often considered a satire, the contents of this netbook widely were ridiculed, railed against, or mocked on various pre-World Wide Web computer systems. Nevertheless, it remained the "number one" download on almost every system that hosted it. The "final" version, dated Jan 1, 1996 (which came in two versions with varying content and format) included a summary detailing the controversy. Entirely devoid of graphics, the document today seems rather silly and benign.

203687.name: Porcunipine
203687.description:
User Summary

While this game has a single player mode, it's really only to practice for multiplayer. As a porcupine, you have one quill to shoot at other players (or NPC enemies). You pick up skulls for points.

203688.name: Castle Loot
203688.description:
From the publisher:

You are about to enter the biggest castle of the most terrifying dragon. Only the fastest but the most vigilant hero will know fame and glory. Others will probably never leave the castle alive…

Castle Loot is a competitive game in which players rely on their reflexes and some judgment to win. One of the four characters, who is greatly inspired by RPG video games, is placed in the middle of the table with all his four equipment tiles surrounding him. The torch will light his path (and allow you to steal a gem from the bag of another player), his sword will be necessary to defend himself against the dragon, his bag will store the gems found and finally, his key will open all the treasure chests that you will find.

In fact, each round, a card is revealed by placing it facing up in the middle of the four equipment tiles. Then, players rush to grab the corresponding equipment of that card.
A dragon? Grab the sword!
A treasure chest? Grab the key!
Gems? Grab the bag!
Stairs? Grab the torch!

Each equipment tile has its own specific effect when it is grabbed at the right moment. But, be careful! Some cards are disguised and contain traps or spiders on them…be quick, but stay vigilant!

203689.description: A no-rules board game that was designed for people to make up their own rules. Clearly, the purpose was more focused on beer drinking than deep strategy.
203689.name: Old Style Pilsner Board Game

203690.name: Cesar's Netbook
203690.description:
User summary:

The oddly named but perennially popular Cesar's Netbook presented a large variety of optional rules for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons 2e, including twelve new Classes, nine new player character Races, eight "half-giant" Races, five new magical items, new spells, new monsters from the "lower planes", and several variant rules regarding character demographics.

For reasons that are not particularly clear, the item is distributed as a pair of files - a brief title page and table of contents (called the "summary"), and then the main body of the document.

203691.description:
One shipment of the Orfeld company has been waylaid in transit across the Sea of Storms. Kardalokan corsairs have captured the cargo ship and stolen the valuables, including a prized golden statue of Tezany, the Shark God. Lord Orfeld needs four brave adventurers to bring back the statue. But is this be a run-of-the-mill recovery mission, or is some mysterious power at work?

Dark Waters is a solo adventure for Four Against Darkness, consisting of one planned dungeon and a random dungeon. 30 pages.

Includes game rules for over 20 water monsters and a new playable class, the Swashbuckler.
203691.name: Dark Waters

203692.description:
The Three Rings is and adventure for Four Against Darkness. It is recommended for character levels 3 and 4. Variable play time.

While exploring a forest, the party stumbles upon a young nobleman. His three seal rings have been stolen by a band of six orc reavers. Catching up with the orcs and retrieving the rings sounds like child's play, but who knows what evil lurks in the forests of Kardalok?
203692.name: The Three Rings

203693.name: The Great Net Book of Classes and Kits
203693.description:
User summary:

The Great Net Book of Classes and Kits Version 1.0 presented new character classes as well as "Kit" builds for standard classes. The document included references to several copyrighted TSR products necessitating a formal license agreement with the distributor, MPG-Net (Multi-Player Games Network).

This item should not be confused with a very similarly named "Great Classes & Kits Netbook" item that was published in two "tomes".

203694.description:
Knight of Destiny is an Arthurian adventure for a single character, a questing paladin, using the Four Against Darkness rules. Your character can also hire retainers along the way, enlisting men-at-arms, merchants, and other travellers to help him in his quest for the Grail.

The Kingdom is in decay. Lancelot has left and King Arthur has fallen ill. Traitor knights, led by Morgana and her unholy child Mordred have rebelled. Only the Grail can heal Arthur and end the evil, but it is a race against time. The traitors are hunting paladins to stop the quest. If the Grail is not found in time, all will be lost to darkness…

This adventure requires no mapping. It includes rules for paladins (and guidelines to use them in your standard Four Against Darkness games), Arthurian magic items, and random tables to generate inns, encounters, quests, and even the names of characters met.
203694.name: The Knight of Destiny

203696.name: Great Classes & Kits Netbook: Tome 1
203696.description:
User summary:

Great Classes & Kits Netbook was published in two "tomes", or volumes. Tome 1 includes 34 new Classes, and new Kits for Priests, Psionics, Rogues, Warriors, and Wizards.

Note the two "Tomes" are not divided alphabetically or thematically. This item should not be confused with the very similarly named "Great Net Book of Classes & Kits". This item also was widely circulated under the title "Spook's Kits & Classes Netbook".

203697.name: Great Classes & Kits Netbook: Tome 2
203697.description:
User summary:

Great Classes & Kits Netbook was published in two "tomes", or volumes. Tome 1 includes 35 new Classes, and new Kits for Priests, Psionics, Rogues, Warriors, Wizards, and Bards.

Note the two "Tomes" are not divided alphabetically or thematically. This item should not be confused with the very similarly named "Great Net Book of Classes & Kits". This item also was widely circulated under the title "Spook's Kits & Classes Netbook".

203698.name: Out of Blackest Earth
rpgitemversion: Out of Blackest Earth PDF Version
Ur den Svartaste Jord PDF Version
203698.description:
Publisher blurb:

Residents of the small town of Uriah are concerned.

The grave site at St. Athanasius Church has lain derelict for a generation. But even if the ground is covered in dead leaves, and some graves are so weathered that the bones are visible, townspeople have nevertheless continued to visit their family grave sites. Recently, however, ghostly apparitions have been reported...

Ur den Svartaste Jord presents a cursed burial locale suitable for beginning adventurers in any "old school" retro-clone.

203699.name: Treasure Trove 1: Challenge 1 Treasures
203699.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement is designed to speed the Game Master’s efforts in creating treasure troves for use in the game, beginning with Player Character level 1.

User summary:

Includes a series of random tables and a basic system for rapidly generating treasure.

203700.name: The Travelers' Handbook (5e)
203700.description:
From the introduction:

The Travelers' Handbook presents practical resources for Dungeon Masters. Basic travel information, descriptions for 500 NPCs, stats for hundreds of NPCs, vehicle tables, mounts tables, individual horse tables, random events tables, encounter tables, monster lists, and treasure tables are included.

203701.name: Saga of the Elder City 1: Random City State Events
203701.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement is devoted to turning your game’s largest fantasy city into an epic locale for adventure. This book is not about running encounters with people, beasts, or monsters, specifically (although I have developed tables for those topics as well). Rather, it is designed to fill your game with random events and witnessed scenes of interest, where the adventuring Player Characters might choose to do something completely random which leads to an evening of unpredictable play. These events could each easily lead into further urban adventures, criminal misbehavior, rough-and-tumble melees, amusing roleplaying scenes, or haunting moments of pure atmosphere. Using this book as an improvisatory idea engine, the Game Master can turn a boring and lifeless city (e.g., one which is never described in game any more than, "You guys need to heal for seven days before you can go back into the dungeon") into an intriguing destination that your players will learn to love.

203702.name: What to do with Prisoners?
203702.description:
From the introduction:

Other bands of adventurers are at work in the region, some of them have had cause to take prisoners. The usual practice is to deliver them to a nearby town or outpost where they are held until they can be transferred to a city for judgment.

Adventurers looking for work, can make a few coins escorting prisoners across the countryside.

User summary:

A morally troublous adventure for 4th level characters.

203703.name: Jutaku
203703.description: In Jutaku you will take on the role of a famous or emerging Japanese architect with the goal of building small homes on a strange or limited size property. It is a real time dexterity based game where players will build with geometric pieces to stack up to certain building requirements.

203704.name: The Right Stuff (5e)
203704.description:
From the introduction:

Airships can take men and gnomes into the sky, but what can reach further? What adventures wait in the upper limits and beyond?

A kidnapped engineer leads the party on an adventure unlike any other...

User summary:

For 3rd - 5th level characters.

203705.name: Making Silence / Breaking Silence
203705.description:
User summary:

The game deals directly and bluntly with domestic violence and presents an intense and often frightening play experience. It is suggested only for mature, committed roleplayers.

The game is distributed as a ZIP archive containing numerous PDF files, some of which are print-and-play components.


Game Book (23-page PDF)
Playbook: Bystanders (2-page PDF)
Playbook: Husband (2-page PDF)
Playbook: Wife (2-page PDF)
Briefing Packet (16-page PDF)
Facilitator Sheet (1-page tracking PDF)
Cards: Husband (8-page PDF; double-sided cards)
Cards: Wife (14-page PDF; double-sided cards)

203706.name: Complete Net Psionics Handbook
203706.description:
From the introduction:

The idea of psionics has evolved tremendously since it's introduction in 1st Edition as a 'sub-class'. In the days of 1st Edition it was about as common to have a character with psionics as it was to have a bard in the party. Since 2nd Edition, the whole thing has stayed the same, the chance of having a character with psionics still is the same chance of having a bard in the party. Luckily for all of us, bards have become possible for characters at 1st level and the psionicist character class was also born. The psionicist opens up new doors of possibility with their ability to penetrate any magic resistance. These characters can quickly make enemies of any mage foolish enough to tangle with them. Like mages though, they are week at lower levels.

User summary:

The PDF version of the document is distributed as a ZIP archive containing numerous TTF (True Type Font) files - unfortunately, these must be installed on the local machine to render a usable PDF document.

203707.name: Police Precinct: Dice Tower Exclusive Character Set
203707.description:
2 Character Boards that were available during the Kickstarter for the Dice Tower but also available at Dice Tower Con and direct from the publisher - Common Man Games

Includes:
Richard Austria
Michelle Schroeder

203708.name: Police Precinct: ONLINE Character Set
203708.description:
3 double sided Character Boards that were available during the Kickstarter for the Police Precinct online app

Includes:
Dave Bremer / Reference Chart
Jan Moore / Dave Moore
Abril Avila / Kendal West

203709.name: Fliegen Klatschen: Rote Fliegenklatsche promo cards
203709.description:
2 promo cards for the Fliegen klatschen.
There are fly swatter on the cards. Once played the players try to "swat" the less numerous color of fly by placing their hands over fly cards of this color. The fastest players get the flies.

203710.name: Cake Duel
203710.description:
Cake Duel is a fast paced two-player card game. Players play the role of opposing Sheepie generals in the grand tournament of cakes.

Players start a round with several cake tokens each and take turns playing Sheepie cards to steal cakes from the other player. The first player to take all the cakes wins the round. The first player to win three rounds wins the duel. The catch is that all cards are played face down, so any card can be bluffed as any other card, and all plays can be challenged, instantly ending the round. Each round comes with new opportunities to make tricky plays and mind game the other player. Experienced players can also keep track of which cards have been played and bluff strategically to strengthen their attacks.

The basic deck contains 20 cards: 12 attackers, 7 blockers, and a Wolf which can only be played by bluffing. There are also 10 special cards, two of which are randomly added to the basic deck at the beginning of each duel. These special cards all change up the basic game in their own way, either by adding special mechanics, or altering the balance of power. Players discover which special cards are in the deck over the course of the duel, and can use this information to make more believable plays and deduce which of their opponent's plays are likely to be bluffs.

203713.name: Gates: Mana Wars
203713.description:
From the publisher:

Gates is a competitive, turn based board game with strong aspect of deck building and managing unruly creatures. All of this in an original world of magic and heroes. The first board from the Basic Set is adjusted for two players, where they must fight over limited resources of mana and outsmart an opponent.

To cast a spell a player needs mana and a card. Every spell has its own effects, sometimes divided into few verses. So you are in control on how much mana spent and which effects you wish to unleash upon your opponent and the battlefield. Anyway, imagine a situation where your silly enemy throws a fireball in your face. What could you do? Of course, there is an interrupt option, why not. Or you could summon a creature that will cover you with its own body. Erect a wall of stones to block the missile. Or cast your own fireball and make it clash like in Dragon Ball series!

Ultimate goal of this duel is to defeat everyone foolish enough to compete with you. Unless you fight against one one the Legendary Beasts, which means you need to cooperate as a team to defeat this monstrosity.

203714.name: Stranger Things Happen
203714.description:
User Summary

Playest based on Kelly Link's books and stories.

203715.description:
The annual pheasant shoot at Leverstoke Hall is always eagerly anticipated and forms the principal topic of speculation at September soirees across four counties. This year promises to be no exception, with two dozen of the region's most prominent landowners shortly to descend upon those hallowed woods for a weekend of impeccable social graces and bloody slaughter.

You, an ambitious young adventurer, are among those favoured few by simple expedient of a forged letter of introduction. And while the gentry pass the weekend in depriving the local copses of their birdlife, you plan to pass the time seducing four of their most delectable young wives, and relieving them of their jewels.

For you are such an attractive and nimble young person that success is assured, if only you can contrive some time alone with each of them. This won't be easy, under the watchful eyes of husbands and associated private secretaries. But if it were easy then there would be no fun in it, would there?

The Shooting Party is a solitaire game that can be played with a standard pack of cards. Your hand represents the guests in the room with you; manage their comings and goings within the strict rules of etiquette so as to reduce your hand to a single queen. Once alone with her you can score her and take her jewels (ace) if available. How many queens and aces you take determines your final score, from impecunious boor to filthy (rich) scoundrel.
203715.name: The Shooting Party
boardgamepodcastepisode: 1P 112 - The Solo System

203716.name: Ta-Da!
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 65 - Conan BA Holiday Special
Episode 67 - The Manhattan Project: Energy Empire and OrcaCon 2017
Episode 79- Junk Art and GenCon 2016, CONTEST!
Episode 93- Clank! and The Dark Side of Gaming: Obsession
Grifters Board Game Review
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 93!!
203716.description:
Description from the publisher:

This year's annual Wizard Talent Show promises to be an exciting event with skilled witches and wizards attending from far and wide. Players will attempt to prove they are the most talented and deserving spellcaster of the bunch.

Ta-Da! is played over a number of fast-paced, frantic rounds. Each player furiously rolls dice in an effort to collect the elements needed to cast their spell. With each roll, players can add one die to their spell, then must reroll the rest. As soon as they have completed their spell, they yell "Ta-da!" and they're one step closer to winning the Talent Show.

However, game-changing feats will be in play throughout the game, making players perform crazy acts as they play, such as making animal noises, keeping their heads on the table, and more!

203717.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Iron Keep Expansion
203717.description:
The Iron Keep is a massive fortress, surrounded by and slowly sinking into a mass of molten iron.
The Iron Keep Expansion includes new enemy miniatures to be used with Dark Souls: The Board Game.

Contains The Dark Souls 2 Smelter Demon boss.

203718.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Armour Set Expansion
203718.description:
The Armour Set Expansion for Dark Souls: The Board Game' includes new armored character models to replace the basic player miniatures when the player discovers and equips them.

Contains 10 miniatures and their corresponding cards.

203719.description:
Description from the publisher:

The World of Twelve is a little planet in the Krosmoz universe that is home to millions of warriors and adventurers who just want a simple life. However, life never stays simple for long as Demons from another dimension are always plucking up these warriors to fight in the arena for their amusement.

In Krosmaster Arena 2.0, players pit their combat skills against one another to earn glory in battle. It will take careful planning and tactical execution for these warriors to come out on top. Players must tap into all of their magical powers and brute strength. It could be the difference between walking out of the arena and being carried out.

Krosmaster Arena 2.0 is compatible with previous Krosmaster figure releases.
203719.name: Krosmaster Arena 2.0

203722.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Invaders Expansion
203722.description:
The Invaders Expansion for Dark Souls: The Board Game adds new invader miniatures to the game as enemy encounters.

Contains 10 popular invader miniatures from the Dark Souls universe.

203723.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Summoned Expansion
203723.description:
The Summoned Expansion for Dark Souls: The Board Game adds the ability to summon characters for assistance to aid in your fight!

Contains 9 summon miniatures and their corresponding cards.

203724.description:
The Mega Boss Expansions enhance your board game experience. These models are big - the Gaping Dragon is around 12-15cm tall! They also come with additional items to support their gameplay:

A Tileset for the Mega Boss Encounter (vary in quantity dependent on the boss)
1 Boss Dial for tracking damage
A Unique Mega Boss AI Deck that fully replicates their movements and attacks within the actual game itself
Specific Mega Boss Treasure Cards
203724.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Black Dragon Kalameet Boss Expansion

203725.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Guardian Dragon Boss Expansion
203725.description:
The Mega Boss Expansions enhance your board game experience. These models are big - the Gaping Dragon is around 12-15cm tall! They also come with additional items to support their gameplay:

A Tileset for the Mega Boss Encounter (vary in quantity dependent on the boss)
1 Boss Dial for tracking damage
A Unique Mega Boss AI Deck that fully replicates their movements and attacks within the actual game itself
Specific Mega Boss Treasure Cards

203726.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – The Four Kings Boss Expansion
203726.description:
The Mega Boss Expansions enhance your board game experience. These models are big - the Gaping Dragon is around 12-15cm tall! They also come with additional items to support their gameplay:

A Tileset for the Mega Boss Encounter (vary in quantity dependent on the boss)
1 Boss Dial for tracking damage
A Unique Mega Boss AI Deck that fully replicates their movements and attacks within the actual game itself
Specific Mega Boss Treasure Cards

Contains four individual boss miniatures.

203727.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Old Iron King Boss Expansion
203727.description:
The Mega Boss Expansions enhance your board game experience. These models are big - the Gaping Dragon is around 12-15cm tall! They also come with additional items to support their gameplay:

A Tileset for the Mega Boss Encounter (vary in quantity dependent on the boss)
1 Boss Dial for tracking damage
A Unique Mega Boss AI Deck that fully replicates their movements and attacks within the actual game itself
Specific Mega Boss Treasure Cards

203728.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Vordt of the Boreal Valley Boss Expansion
203728.description:
The Mega Boss Expansions enhance your board game experience. These models are big - the Gaping Dragon is around 12-15cm tall! They also come with additional items to support their gameplay:

A Tileset for the Mega Boss Encounter (vary in quantity dependent on the boss)
1 Boss Dial for tracking damage
A Unique Mega Boss AI Deck that fully replicates their movements and attacks within the actual game itself
Specific Mega Boss Treasure Cards

203729.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Player Characters Expansion
203729.description:
The Player Characters Expansion adds new miniatures and classes to Dark Souls: The Board Game.

Includes 6 miniatures with new classes: Pyromancer, Cleric, Thief, Sorcerer, Mercenary, and Deprived.

203730.name: Conflict: Middle East Political Simulator
203730.description:
Conflict: Middle East Political Simulator, often known as ConfMEPS or simply Conflict, is a turn-based government simulation game. It was designed by David J. Eastman and published by Virgin Interactive in 1990 for DOS, Atari ST and Amiga (with extended graphics). The game is available for free download at abandonware sites.

The game is set in 1997. The Prime Minister of Israel has just been assassinated, leaving the player to run the country as the new Prime Minister. The player's objective is to cause the defeat of the neighboring four states, either by invasion (not necessarily by Israel, as the other states can and do invade each other) or political destabilization.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conflict%3A_Middle_East_Political_Simulator Conflict: Middle East Political Simulator]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

203731.name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – Core Game Expansion
203731.description:
The Core Game Expansion adds new terrain miniatures in the form of chests, barrels, gravestone, and a bonfire, as well as new adversaries to enhance Dark Souls: The Board Game.

Also contains The Pursuer and Sir Alonne boss miniatures.

203732.name: Konflikt '47: US Army Starter Set
203732.description:
As World War II continues beyond 1945, the battling countries have become even more desperate to develop new super weapons to give them a winning advantage. Exploiting new technologies revealed from the first nuclear explosions, the Axis and Allied forces quickly develop new tanks and strange armoured walkers to become the vanguard of their armies, supported by new highly equipped or terribly twisted troops. With the Soviet Union seceding from the Allies the war now becomes a three-way conflict!

Konflikt ’47 is a standalone game inspired by the hugely successful Bolt Action, designed by Clockwork Goblin Miniatures and produced by Warlord Games and Osprey Publishing. Adding to the core rules that many gamers are familiar with from Bolt Action, Konflikt ’47 allows the addition of completely new types of units and models to existing 28mm Bolt Action armies and the creation of completely new forces set in the alternate future of 1947.

Konflikt ’47 introduces ‘Weird War’ weaponry – including the stunning range of walkers and other mechanical monstrosities!

Contains:

A5 softback Konflikt '47 rulebook
1 M5A2 Coyote light walker
1 M4A9 Sherman-T medium tank
20 US infantry
5 US heavy infantry
pin markers
6 six-sided dice
6 Orders dice

203733.name: Konflikt '47: German Army Starter Set
203733.description:
As World War II continues beyond 1945, the battling countries have become even more desperate to develop new super weapons to give them a winning advantage. Exploiting new technologies revealed from the first nuclear explosions, the Axis and Allied forces quickly develop new tanks and strange armoured walkers to become the vanguard of their armies, supported by new highly equipped or terribly twisted troops. With the Soviet Union seceding from the Allies the war now becomes a three-way conflict!

Konflikt ’47 is a standalone game inspired by the hugely successful Bolt Action, designed by Clockwork Goblin Miniatures and produced by Warlord Games and Osprey Publishing. Adding to the core rules that many gamers are familiar with from Bolt Action, Konflikt ’47 allows the addition of completely new types of units and models to existing 28mm Bolt Action armies and the creation of completely new forces set in the alternate future of 1947.

Konflikt ’47 introduces ‘Weird War’ weaponry – including the stunning range of walkers and other mechanical monstrosities!

Contains:

A5 softback Konflikt '47 rulebook
1 Spinne Light Panzermech
1 PzIV-X medium tank
24 Grenadiers
8 Totenkorps
pin markers
6 six-sided dice
6 Orders dice

203734.name: Death Trap (1990)
203734.description:
From the back of the game box

A trap so deadly that it has remained inviolate for fice centuries, so ingenious that it gentle lures an intruder to a certain death, a trap worthy of Shankriya, the magician king, a tyrant and absolute ruler of vast lands.

THe trap is set in a multi level labyrinth deep in the bowels of the earth and populated by creatures vile, vicious and venomous. Within it lay hidden, the magic scrolls, sources of Shankriya's powers.


Five levels, each with 100 screens of individual graphics
Superb Arcade action
Numerous enemies, with changing behaviour pattern and artificial intelligence to give added gameplay
50 HZ refresh time to enhance the quality of animation and pixel perfect smooth scrolling.
Superfast loading for each level. No disc access during the game.


DEATH TRAP
A DEATH WISH COME TRUE!

203735.name: Man and Ubermensch
203735.description:
From the introduction:

He abolished the gold standard. He needed a wheelchair. The war was taking too long. He locked up innocent Japanese citizens. He'd served more terms than George Washington.

He wasn't a particularly good President.

They replaced him, and a good thing too!

Hans Homm is a proper Commander-in-Chief. He has blond hair and blue eyes, a firm jaw and a fierce right hook. As of a month ago, he's even an American citizen – and a damn good one too!

Not everyone is a good citizen.

203736.name: Clapper
videogamehonor: 2016 AzPlay Awards Most Original Game Idea Nominee
203736.description:
Clapper is a 2 player cooperative rhythm and clap game. The game is most easily visualized as a mix between digital rhythm games and traditional hand clapping games played on schoolyards around the world. Clapper has a unique input method that make use of the camera to distinguish between 5 different types of claps. For instance Clapper can distinguish between straight or diagonal claps, or claps being performed with both hands at the same time. Clapper is aimed towards children, parents, grandparents and music teachers and is currently available for iPad.

Source: The Game Website.

203737.name: It Came From the Wild Blue Yonder!
203737.description:
From the introduction:

The Termagant is loose on the fields of Frangistan! Who can stop its heathen passage? If the call to prayer is for the flock, where's the shepherd?

203738.name: Darkening Skies: Tales of the Wild Blue Yonder, Chapter 2
203738.description:
From the introduction:

Darkening Skies over the planet of Haven. An Imperial warship, half-a-kilometer long and heavily armed, lies still and
unresponsive. Her shadow falls across continents.

The Trade Union are spooked. They'll blow the ship to pieces; try to forget it ever existed. But there were people on that ship, soldiers and prisoners, and enough weaponry to equip an army.

So a rag-tag band approaches the ship in a cheap and collapsing boat. One searches for friends, another for adventure. One looks for love and one looks for profit.

One looks for answers.

203739.description:
The Officially Licensed Evil Dead 2 Board Game pits 2 to 6 players against an arcane evil-spewing portal - and each other. Players cooperate to gather pages of the Necronomicon Ex-Mortis to seal the portal before everyone gets a bad case of being dead. Since not even the battle of good and evil is a simple thing, players may also end up possessed! If a player turns Deadite, it's their goal to corrupt or kill the surviving humans. Meanwhile, those humans can attempt to save their cursed companions at a cost or take them out and hope they stay dead.

Each player's turn is comprised of three steps, always in the following order: Event, Move, Action. Once each player takes a turn that's called a round. At the end of each round, all Enemies take their turn:

EVENT
Each player draws an event card which they must immediately play.

MOVE All characters can move up to two spaces in any direction or may choose to stay put. Items and Ex-Mortis Pages on the board may be picked up by moving over them, but characters cannot stop to take an Action and then continue moving. A Character will pick up whatever is on their space before having to take any Action on that space, such as Attacking an Enemy.

ACTION
After moving, the player may make Actions as defined by an Item Card. There is no limit to the number of Actions a Player takes on their turn, given they're all viable Actions. However, any one specific Action may only be attempted once per turn unless otherwise noted.

WINNING
There are 9 unique Ex-Mortis Pages that form one big picture. However, duplicates of these pages have been scattered throughout the cabin and ground, some with greater frequency that others. The players must gather up one of each in order to close the portal.
203739.name: Evil Dead 2: The Official Board Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: 14. Devon Dice Podcast - Runemeet vs the Spiel Des Jahres Nominees
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 023 – Zero Marks!
Episode 3 - Scare Tactics
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 126

203740.description:
Description from the publisher:

Age of Thieves is a fantasy board game of strategy and adventure set in Hadria, a port metropolis located on the northern fringes of a mighty Empire. Each player becomes a master thief about to commit the most daring burglary of his career. During the game players may use unique abilities of their thieves as well as various action cards, which represent maneuvers, alchemical potions or complicated devices inspired by visionary ideas of Renaissance inventors. The players choose cards to play and then use available Action Points to plan the order of their activities. This makes the game very dynamic, with each resolved action dramatically influencing the turn. The players’ order changes dynamically depending on the number of Action Points placed on each chosen card.

The goal of the game is to break into the vault inside the Emperor's palace and steal the Emperors' Jewel, the symbol of power very precious to the ruling dynasty. However, this is hardly the end, because thieves must escape from the city with their loot. This is no easy task - the streets are patrolled by vigilant city guards and veteran captains well versed in all criminal tricks. Additionally, time is running fast for the thieves - event cards introduced each turn control the flow of the game, escalating its pace and difficulty of challenges for the players to overcome.

The thief who will manage to escape through one of four city gates taking with him the Emperors’ Jewel or other valuable loot will be the winner of the game. Anyone who will stay inside Hadria after resolving the last event card will be caught and mercilessly thrown inside the city dungeon, their names erased from the annals of the omnipotent Guild.
203740.name: Age of Thieves
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 103 -- Whisky, Pips and Pancakes
HLG 10: Meer Essen
The Game Pit: Episode 70 - Spiel 2016 Treasure Hunt Part 1

203741.name: The Echoes of Heaven Campaign Setting (5e)
203741.description:
From the back of the book:

Areniel leaped off the parapets of Heaven. The stone battlements of the city fell away beneath him even as rolling lands stretched out on all sides. On his flanks the rest of the Host rose in unison - the hand of God, propelled by His will. As Areniel flew into the air, the lush fields of Heaven fell into the distance, a yellow-flecked expanse of grass stirring in the wind of a thousand angelic wings. The Fallen Host flew above them, vicious weapons glittering in the in the light, their armor blackened in the absence of God's glory. Soon they'd glisten with blood...

The Echoes of Heaven is a game world of darkness and danger, where a monolithic church has split into dozens of quarreling factions and holy war looms like a shadow. Here, strength and brutality win the day and only those with the most faith, honor and courage can stand against the terrible tyranny of those who would enslave everyone of a different belief, a different philosophy, a different race.

Worse, it is a world infected by the very fabric of Hell itself.

203742.name: Dark & Dangerous
203742.description:
Rules for a Dark and Gritty Game Experience

From the introduction:

If you want your D&D 5e games to feel more like an old school RPG, where the lives of characters hangs by a thread at all times, where magic is dangerous and something to be used with caution, where you are not playing as heroes but rather as survivors, look no further than this!

203743.name: Eskimo Games
203743.description:
From the back of the game box
Off you go into endless regions of ice! The little inhabitants of the arctic cold challenge you to a competition in snowball throwing, collecting eggs, building igloos, sharing out ice and boxing. A polar bear is also around to make life difficult for you. You have to face him personally in the boxing ring. The key words are speed, perseverance and skill, because all are out ro distract you. "Slush and broken ice!?!"

203744.name: Critical Miss Tables - Combat
203744.description:
From the introduction:

A series of tables that will give you flavorful and meaningful effects when your players or NPCs roll critical failures in combat.

Contains differing entries for every type of attack and spell.

203745.description:
From the publisher:

“I bring only death and leave only corpses.”
–Jain Zar, Phoenix Lord of the Howling Banshees

Against the Great Enemy is the fifth War Pack in the Death World cycle for Warhammer 40,000: Conquest.

As a rain of blood pours down on Nectavus VI, the forces of Chaos run rampant, eager to devour this verdant, deadly world. Noisome daemons and foul Warp-things alike are opposed by the might of the Imperium—powerful Space Marines and legions of the Astra Militarum—but unbeknownst to all who bleed and die on this tormented world, a new player has entered the scene. An Eldar Phoenix Lord has joined the fight, moving invisibly and bringing death without warning. Her only goal is to destroy those who have brought the abomination of Chaos into the material realm, and she will slay any who stand in her way.

Against the Great Enemy is a new War Pack in the Death World cycle, and within this expansion, you’ll continue to find support for this cycle’s major themes. Additional Deep Strike cards enter the card pool, giving your units, attachments, and events new ways to arrive at the battlefield unseen by your foes. Elite units continue to become more effective and dangerous, even as a new Eldar warlord and her signature squad invite you to lead the Howling Banshees into the battle for Nectavus VI!
203745.name: Warhammer 40,000: Conquest – Against the Great Enemy

203746.name: Unforgiving Trials: The Darkest Crusade
203746.description:
User Summary

This RPG lets you choose from several characters and the plot leads you to fight the monstrosity that is devastation the land. The combat is choose the warrior and the enemy but with a bit of a roguelike element.

203747.name: USS John Young
203747.description:
From Amiga Action, Issue 16, January 1991
By the year 1997 the situation of the world has changed dramatically, and mot fir the better of the Euroeans. After the decline of NATO, European power declined as well. In a moce that surprised all the nations of the world, the Arab countries headed by Iran suddenly launched an attack on shipping,m creating an economic brockade, They had build a world wide military navy and used it to dominate the seas.

With living standards rapidly deteriorating in the countries that could not support themselvesdue to the lack of trading, a decision was made that something had to be done to end this evil reign, The heads of the various nations came together and devised a plan. The U.S.S. John Young, supposedly vrewed by renegade navy personnel would be sent into the confliuct areas, and would hopefully be able to move around without being attacked due to their socalled defecetion.

You are put in the contorl of John Young as it roams the violent seas of the world. Your objective: To seek and destroy the Arab forces whereever they may be, This is simulated in four different missions. However, it's not just other ships you will be attacking: Oil rigs will be one of your main targets; destroying these helps weakeen the enemy forces.

There are also four different map locations that you can choose to do battle in, ranging from the Persian Gulf to the Falkland Islands. Day and night time can also be chosen from, the advantage being that at night you can get closer to the enemy before they see you.

203748.name: Equipment Packs 2
203748.description:
From the introduction:

Six new and five alternate equipment packs, plus variant encumbrance rule.

User summary:

Provides alternative starting equipment packs for newly created characters.

203749.name: Equipment Packs 3
203749.description:
From the introduction:

Thirty new and five alternate equipment packs, plus variant encumbrance rules.

User summary:

Provides alternative starting equipment packs for newly created characters.

203750.name: Orbs of Oblivion
203750.description:
From the introduction:

Orbs are spheres, usually made of glass, that often contain strong magical properties. These magics are sometimes passive, while others require activation from its owners. An orb’s power can only be utilized if held with at least one free hand. Orbs come in various sizes, but are usually about 10 inches in diameter.

User summary:

Presents nineteen magical orbs of various power levels.

boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
203752.description:
Recreate the epic, existential drama of an entire continent in Statecraft's first Deluxe Expansion, The Supranational Union. Play in teams or on your own as either the Federalists or the Separatists, each struggling for dominance over the 12 member states and ultimately for control of the Federal Council, and the soul of the continent.

The 13 scenarios and whole range of supplementary cards expand the core Statecraft system to an epic 20-hour campaign, playable as a series of specialised Statecraft scenarios.

Will you fight for unity or independence?
203752.name: Statecraft: the Political Card Game – the Supranational Union

boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
203753.description: Extreme Supporters come with insanely hard to claim preferences, as well as additional special requirements to claim them, making them particularly difficult to manage. Extreme Supporters are shuffled and replace one supporter in the floating supporters area at the start of the game.
203753.name: Statecraft: the Political Card Game – Extreme Supporters Pack

203754.name: Statecraft: the Political Card Game – Extreme Policies Pack
boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)
203754.description:
A set of 10 incendiary and controversial policies from around the world. Extreme Policies are shuffled and one is dealt to each player at the start of the game. Extreme Policies have very large ideology points in some areas but also have negative ideology points in others.
