Please note that the Extreme Policies Pack would likely not be appropriate for a younger audience, most workplaces or family gatherings.

203755.description:
From the publisher:

"There is no knowing what he can do, or may choose to try. A wild beast cornered is not safe to approach. And Saruman has powers you do not guess. Beware of his voice!"
–Gandalf, The Two Towers

Combined in one single, sixty-card package, The Treason of Saruman Nightmare Decks for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game introduce new setup and encounter decks that greatly increase the difficulty of the three scenarios from The Treason of Saruman Saga Expansion.

With a focus on the treacherous Wizard and his fearsome Uruk-hai, these Nightmare Decks raise the stakes of your adventures with Aragorn and company as you pursue your captive companions, fight alongside the Rohirrim at the defense of Helm's Deep, and march against the fortress of Isengard. Simultaneously, they introduce new themes and story elements, such as the arrival of Mauhur’s Orcs and the dastardly effect of Saruman’s Wizardry.
203755.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Nightmare Deck: The Treason of Saruman
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

203756.name: Twizmo! Words
203756.description:
Description from the publisher:

Twizmo! Words is all about ­finding and building words using the letters on the top of Twizmo! Word Cube and the letters on the cards. Letters on the cube can be used in any order, and as many or as few times as desired. A player is not required to use all the letters on the cube, but their word must include the letter on the card for that turn. To win, players collect the letter cards during their turns to score the most points.

Each turn starts with the flip of a letter card. The letter on the card must be used—together with any letters on the top face of the cube. There is always a designated “Player” who must guess a word of at least four letters. However, if any opponent can shout out a SEVEN letter word before Player has called a word, that opponent can take the card as his own.

Twizmo! Words contains twelve “Game Changer” cards, dealt evenly to players before each game. These cards provide players with an arsenal of “secret weapons”, which they can use to surprise their opponents at just the right time.

203757.description:
Dogfights with new aircrafts, raids with Zeppelins, sinking ships with torpedoes and landing on aircraft-carrier : Le Temps des As II - Age of Aces II is a follow-up to Le Temps des As - Age of Aces, a tactical game about aerial warfare in the 1916-1918 period. Take control of this fast and furious game system with minimal use of markers and no pre-plotting. The game can be played with solo scenarios or with 2 or more players.

Le Temps des As II - Age of Aces II is a stand-alone game that can be combined with Le Temps des As - Age of Aces published in Vae Victis magazine issue #117.
203757.name: Le Temps des As II

203758.name: Fought Wheels: Matchbox Wars
203758.description:
Description from the designer:

Fought Wheels: Matchbox Wars is a game of tactical combat with an RPG element for 2 - 6 players. It uses existing 1/64 scale vehicles that are commonly bought as toys, as well as household items to create terrain and obstacles.

The rules are written in parody/homage of miniatures bookshelf games from the 1980s; all with low ink, black and white, and retro art.

Each team of three cars is trying to gain the most victory points through a variety of actions. Destroying enemy vehicles, capturing a flags, and successfully completing "sick" jump routines are a few ways to gain victory points. Each mission has a victory point chart that is referred to at the end of each round.

203759.description:
Hope is fading as the dead drive out the living. There’s nowhere left to run, and all that’s left is survival. There is no rescue party waiting, no help from kind strangers...in the world of The Walking Dead, there is no sanctuary…

The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary is a cooperative board game of desperate survival set in the world of the popular AMC television series. Designed by Adam and Brady Sadler (Warhammer Quest: The Adventure Card Game), No Sanctuary puts players in the roles of iconic survivors from The Walking Dead, working together against desperate odds as they navigate a variety of scenarios. Whether the survivors are scavenging for supplies, fighting off waves of the dead, or even standing toe-to-toe with the living, the group must find a way to work together even when its members’ interests may be at odds.

No Sanctuary features a unique leadership mechanic in which players take turns assuming the role of the group’s leader. Each turn, the leader must choose the group’s approach by drawing two event cards and choosing one. Since players cannot discuss this decision, the pressure is on the leader, and the leader alone will pay the price if the group is unable to follow the approach for the turn. Make enough bad decisions, and the leader may have to relinquish his role and let the next survivor take charge of the group.

Each survivor in No Sanctuary comes with a unique deck of cards to represent their special actions and abilities, as well as their flaws. This deck not only drives each survivor’s playstyle, but it also serves their health, so hand management is crucial to surviving each scenario. Equally important as staying alive, group morale is an essential part of the game. Many game effects will cause morale to drop, and if it reaches zero, the players lose the game. Maintaining the group’s tenuous psychological stability is just as important as staying alive!

With its unique gameplay and innovative leadership mechanic, No Sanctuary offers players a deep and engaging way to experience their favorite episodes of The Walking Dead, and even explore beyond the show’s storylines!
203759.name: The Walking Dead: No Sanctuary
boardgamepodcastepisode: 14. Devon Dice Podcast - Runemeet vs the Spiel Des Jahres Nominees
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 024 – Top 10 iOS Games
HLG 7: Op de foto
RDTN Episode 98: Cry Havoc, The Walking Dead – No Sanctuary, Sadler Brothers and Ignacy
The Game Pit: Episode 66 - Scythe and more….

203760.name: Estado de Sitio
203760.description:
From the publisher (translated):

With Estado de Sitio we enter in the most dangerous prision on the planet, not only the most dangerous on the planet also the largest... In fact the prision is an entire city.

A city walled and guarded by the army, inside wich the worst kind serving a sentence.

Behind the city walls, criminals ready for anything, able to extort, steal or risk their lives just for a cigarette, are organized to dispute control of the streets and scarce resources that exist in prison.

Our mission will be to lead one of those bands, and with the band, we will try to control most of the prison that we possibly can. But also we will have another mission, we must ensure that our leader going to escape from prison.

We will have to manage each of our scarce resources to can move through the barricades of the city, we will engage in business with goods on the black market, We will learn trades in prison,
we will lost all our money in the casino, we will falsify documents, we will actively seek alliances with corrupt cops.......

But look out!, your band is not the only willing to do anything in the prison, you have to impose
on the rest of bands to achieve your goals.

In this "boardgame" only a band can win, only one will get the respect of convicts...

This is a game for 2-4 players, Will you be able to lead a band?

From the publisher:
En Estado de sitio nos adentramos en la peor cárcel del planteta, no solo la peor, si no la mayor de ellas, de hecho, es toda una ciudad tapiada y vigilada por el éjercito en cuyo interior la
mayor calaña de la sociedad cumple su condena.

Tras sus muros, criminales dispuestos a todo, capaces de extorsionar, robar o jugarse la vida por unos míseros cigarros, se organizan en bandas para disputarse el control de las calles y de los excasos recursos que existen en la prisión.

Nuestra misión será dirigir una de dichas bandas, y con ella, controlar la mayor cantidad de oficios importantes dentro de la ciudad-prisión, así como intentar, como no, fugarnos con el líder de la banda.

Tendremos que gestionar cada uno de nuestros excasos recursos para movernos hábilmente a través de las númerosas barricadas que nos dificultarán el paso por la ciudad, traficaremos con mercancias en el mercado, aprenderemos oficios, perderemos lo poco que tenemos en el casino, falsificaremos documentos, buscaremos alianzas con policías corruptos o incluso jugaremos a la ruleta rusa con el menos simpático de nuestros camaradas de la banda.

Pero ojo, tu banda no será la única dispuesta a todo para vencer, deberás imponerte al resto de bandas con las que compartirás la prisión...

En este "juego" solo una banda puede "ganar", solo una obtendrá el respeto de todos los reos gracias a sus éxitos en las fugas y a sus oficios adquiridos.

De 2 a 4 jugadores están llamados a este desafío, ¿Serás capaz?

203761.name: Road Rage
203761.description:
User Summary

Play as one of 11 distinct characters with 11 unique and upgradable bike models over nearly 100 total melee and story-based missions. Customizable skins, wheels, weapons including 12 unique melee weapons, and more.

203762.name: Tom and Jerry Gay Double Feature Cartoon Game
203762.description:
This 1948 title may be the earliest board game featuring the famous cat-and-mouse duo. Published by Milton Bradley under license from Loew's Inc. (owner of MGM), it is a spin-and-move game with a twist.

Each player has both a Tom and a Jerry character, and they move in opposite directions around the board. There also is a twin spinner, one for each character. Each players spins both dials on his turn. When both spinners hit the same number, both moves are doubled. First player to get both pieces round the board wins.

The game track includes three kinds of spaces: Cat, Mouse and star. What happens when two pieces meet depends on the space. Stars are safe spots. If two Toms meet on a Mouse space or two Jerrys on a Cat, both are sent home to start over. If a Tom and a Jerry meet, then Tom goes home on a Mouse space and Jerry goes home on a Cat.

The box and rules declare that "This is a Psych Tested Game"... whatever that means.

203763.name: Codex of Arcane, Magical, and Mystical Items
203763.description:
From the introduction:

This is the Codex Of Arcane, Magical, and Mystical Items, also know as the Encyclopedia of Magic Items, or (even) the Encylopædia Arcanum. Whatever the name it is known by, this ancient manuscript is a result of the combined work of dozens of dedicated scholars, each contributing his or her Talent to that most noble of purposes: to further our understanding of Magic. What this tome contains is indeed a boon beyond measurement; for within its covers is as complete a listing as available to date of all magical and strange items. Unfortunately, as Magic is inherently unpredictable and current methods often prove insufficient to predict all possible outcomes, this Codex invariably will contain some errors, although hopefully none of agrevious stature. It is also important to note that many of those which contributed to the knowledge in this work have continued to advance the frontiers of Magical creation themselves, and will most certainly have encountered creations not mentioned in this Codex. Such is the travails of producing a work such as this. However, it is hoped that future publications by the Wizards Guild, in association with Magic Extraordinare! Publications, will keep abreast of this most exciting field. Welcome!

User summary:

This item has been circulated under these names, at various times:


Codex of Arcane, Magical, and Mystical Items
Codex of Arcane, Magic, & Mystic Items
Encyclopedia of Magic Items
Encylopædia Arcanum


The first version circulated in 1994. A major (and final) revision occurred in 1996. Shortly thereafter the compiler converted the item to an HTML page which was made available for download in a ZIP archive.

203764.name: The Cults Netbook
203764.description:
From the introduction:

What you will find here is a collection of [ten] cults, secret societies that worship a god, a creature, or an item.

User summary:

The cults and affiliated items are intended for use primarily as long-term organizational opponents in a campaign. Several minor versions of the netbook have been circulated, all identified as the "first edition". Generally, these vary only in minor formatting or in typographical corrections.

203765.name: The Horus Heresy Book IV: Conquest
203765.description:
The Horus Heresy Book Four – Conquest, lavishly illustrated in full colour, contains extensive background information on Warmaster Horus’ invasion of the northern Imperium after the revelation of his treachery at the Isstvan System.

Additionally, this book contains details of the Solar Auxilia of the Imperial Army and the histories of four Knight Households, as well as two entirely new army lists. The Questoris Knight Crusade Army list enables you to field a full Household of towering Knights armed with devastating weapons of mass destruction, whilst the Solar Auxilia Crusade Army list brings the elite of the Imperial Army to your battlefield.

This book also contains an extensive campaign system which includes alternative Force Organisation charts, new City Fighting and Strategic Raid mission types, new battlefield terrain, options for character advancement and relics of the Dark Age of Technology for every Crusade era army.

The Horus Heresy Book IV: Conquest is a complete expansion for the Warhammer 40,000 game and can be used independently of the previous Horus Heresy expansion books; it only requires the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use.

203766.name: Illustration quest
203766.description:
One player is the storyteller for the turn and looks at the 9 Illustration cards on the table. From three of these, he/s makes up a sentence and says it out loud.

Each other player using own three markers selects the up to three Illustration cards on the table which best matches the sentence, without showing it to the others.

All Illustration are shown face up and every player has to bet upon which picture was the storyteller's.

If nobody finds any of correct card, each of the other players scores 2. Otherwise the storyteller and whoever found the correct answer score from 1 up to 3 points.

The game ends when the deck is empty or if a player scores 30 points. In either case, the player with the most points wins the game.

The base game have 180 different Illustration cards.

203767.name: The Horus Heresy Book V: Tempest
203767.description:
Previously isolated from the brutal devastation of the Horus Heresy as it tore across the Imperium, Mankind’s civil war has now reached Ultramar. The Horus Heresy Book V: Tempest tells of the Word Bearers’ treacherous attack on the Ultramarines at the mustering world of Calth, and of the cataclysmic was that will soon engulf the entire system, pitching not only the Legions against each other, but also the massed ranks of the Imperial Army militia, and the towering god-machines of the Legio Titanicus.

Lavishly illustrated in full colour, this leather bound 270 page book contains an extensive history of the Ultramarines, unit profiles, and an army list as well as rules for the Primarch of the XIIIth Legion, Roboute Guilliman. To represent their part in the conflict, the rules for the Word Bearers Legion have been updated and new units and characters provided for them. The new Imperialis Militia & Cults army list allows you to field the massed troops and war machines of a range of armies raised on a myriad of worlds, including planetary defence forces and twisted Warp cults, with rules to represent your army’s unique background and fighting style.

Additional units for Legiones Astartes and Mechanicum armies are presented within Tempest, such as the Sokar Pattern Stormbird, the Domitar Class Battle-automata, and rules for using the gargantuan Mars Warlord Battle Titan.

Bringing this wealth of source material and game rules together, the Betrayal at Calth campaign lets you refight the apocalyptic battles between the Traitors and the Loyalists, providing missions and rules so you can either fight for Calth, or bring about its utter destruction.

203768.name: The NetBook of Cults & Priests
203768.description:
User summary:

The manual is presented in topical sections: Priest Character Classes; Evil Cults; Neutral Cults; Good Cults; and the fantasy setting. In addition, the item contains as an appendix the entire text of The Cults Netbook which served as the basis of this item. However, the revisions and expansions are notable.

This final "Version 3" edition provided an update with better organization, better standardization, and some expansion of a "Version 2" that (briefly) was circulated as Netbook of Cults Second Edition.

203769.name: Vistascapes VR
203769.description:
User Summary

Enjoy the world around you.

203770.name: Tome of the Damned
203770.description:
From the introduction:

There are a few things that one must know before reading this Tome.... in it, are the secrets of the damned. These secrets have been lying, awaiting their discovery, for thousands, possibly millions of years. Now, a few brave souls have ventured near enough to them, so that their anticipation can await no longer. Opening crypts and tombs, these secrets have been revealed, and they tend to stay that way. The way of the world as we know it, may forever change. Death, Peril, and Damnation await us behind every corner. But, how does that change the world? No one has seen death as horrid as these, peril as depressing as written here, and no one (or no soul), has suffered any kind of damnation that has been recorded within these pages. Gods and heroes clash in the midst of the abyss, while the undead stalk the Material Plane. Oh, what has befallen the world now?

User summary:

Tome of the Damned presents a variety of items, class options, spells, and monsters for general campaign use. Most of the items involve evil or undead in some way.

203771.name: MEMENTO
203771.description:
User Summary

A paradise lost; an island full of memory. Those who forget the horrors of the past will pay the price...

203772.name: Haven Moon
203772.description:
Haven Moon will transport you to a mysterious world where you have to explore abandoned islands and solve their secrets to find a treasure. In this Myst-like game inspired by Jules Verne’s universe, use your senses and intelligence to find your way through secret passages and curious machinery.

Source: The Game Website.

203773.name: Hypnorain
203773.description:
Hypnorain is a vertical bullet hell shooter. The player guides a character through handcrafted levels, shooting and dodging their way through an army of enemies and their mesmerizing bullet patterns.

Source: The Game Website.

203774.name: Asteroids Minesweeper
203774.description:
Be careful of explosive mines! Asteroids Minesweeper is an abstract casual minesweeper variant in three dimensions with some slight rules differences. Trim that asteroid, and don't get too dizzy while rotating in a full 3D environment.

Source: The Game Website.

203775.name: The Lion's Song - Episode 1: Silence
videogamehonor: 2017 IGF Awards Excellence in Narrative Honorable Mention
203775.description:
Preparing for her breakthrough concert, the defining moment of her career. Searching for inspiration she escapes from the pressure for success to the solitude of the Austrian Alps.

Source: The Game Website.

203776.name: Simulcra
203776.description:
User Summary
Simulcra is a game by MicroStyle from 1990. The game is a shoot'em-up in 3D vector graphics. The player is flying a space ship, seen from behind, flying over a landscape of walls, platforms and buildings. There is also flying enemies and cannons. The aim is to beat levels by go from one end of a stage to the other.

203777.name: Kaboom Monsters
203777.description:
User Summary

KaBoom Monsters is a revolutionary fantasy strategic card game.

203778.name: Day D: Tower Rush
203778.description:
https://www.facebook.com/8FloorGames

Onwards to the past! Learn the real power of science! Help the professor and his loyal companion deal with hordes of dinosaurs.

203779.name: Tormented 12
203779.description:
A hero is born in biblical era. The tribes of Israel are at war for their own survival. How far would you go to save your people? How deep is your faith in God?Tormented12 is a historical fantasy game based on the biblical account of the twelve Hebrew tribes.

Source: The Game Website.

203780.description:
In Power Grid: The Card Game, the players represent CEOs of mighty power companies producing electricity.

During the game, the players bid for power plants at auctions and supply them with resources. Their income depends on the amount of electricity produced in each round. At the end of the game, the player who produces the most electricity wins the game.

Power Grid: The Card Game offers all the tension and tactics well-known of its two big brothers — Power Grid and Power Grid deluxe — without using the different maps. You get the full Power Grid emotions in an intensive playing time of sixty minutes!

To give two players an exciting experience, they will play with the Trust acting as a third player. While challenging the opponent, they must incorporate the schemes of the competing Trust in their plans and use these schemes against their opponent.

This game includes a small variant for the Demolition Contractor. This variant is playable with Power Grid: The Card Game, and all maps of Power Grid deluxe and Power Grid!
203780.name: Power Grid: The Card Game

Ep 042 – Essen Spiel 2016 Preview

HLG 11: Stilte voor de Storm
HLG 13: Terugblik op 2016
HLG 7: Op de foto
MN 0140 Hot Games and News from BGG.Con 2016
The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 151

203781.name: Simple Spy
203781.description:
Simple Spy is a dynamic and minimalist 2d platformer. Though Simple Spy is a minimalist platformer,you can also find all fun and essence needed for a full fledged platformer. everything in Simple Spy is achieved through a combination of three action such as running,jumping and rolling.

Source: The Developer Website.

203782.name: Metamorphic
203782.description:
Darkness. Falling. Light. A metallic, geometric cavern surrounds you. A single source of light beckons you forward, up – towards the only exit.

Source: The Game Website.

203783.name: Protonwar
203783.description:
It features strafe jumping, advanced strafe jumping, wall running, wall jumping, step up double jumps and sliding movement mechanics!

Source: The Game Website.

203784.name: Frost
203784.description:
User Summary

Inspired by deck-building board games like Dominion, Ascension and the like.

203786.name: FreeHolder
203786.description:
Blending strategy, survival, and roguelike elements with RPG style character development, FreeHolder is the story of three escaped slaves in the time of the Roman Republic. Farm, hunt, craft, and cook your way through the years as you live on the edge of the beginning of the Empire.

Source: The Developer Website.

203787.name: Inferno Climber
203787.description:
Forge through hell in this survival action RPG! Defeat powerful bosses to collect all 5 Purgatory Stones in hell. Slashing, magic casting, arrow shooting, bombs throwing, exploring, eating, cooking, blacksmithing.

Source: The Publisher Website.

203788.description:
Candy Time is a tile-placing game in which players have to complete pieces of candy. None of the tiles include a whole piece of candy; they have only halves — four halves actually, one on each side of the square tiles, so we have to combine our tiles with the ones on the table to complete one, two, or even three candies. Some candies are worth one point, others two points, and some of them let us play an additional tile.

The game starts with a wall of candy tiles on the table, all of them placed randomly. Players receive three tiles, and they play one per turn, placing it on the table and taking as many tiles as pieces of candy that have been completed. The tiles don't have to match every single side, so if we place a tile touching three others but only matching two of the sides, we take those two tiles and leave the rest. We keep aside the tiles that we get from the table as they are our points. The tile that we played stays on the table, and we receive a new one at the end of our turn so that we always have three from which to choose. Whoever gets the most candies wins!
203788.name: Candy Time
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016

203789.name: Genios divertidos
203789.description:
Genios divertidos is a party game, Players have to successfully complete activities in each of four sections to win:


Piensa (to think):Players must answer questions of different topics



Actúa (to act: players must act a word or clue



Escribe (to write): Players must solve an ortographic challenge



Crea (to create): Players must draw a clue


Juego de mesa tipo trivia donde se juega en cuatro categorias: Piensa, actúa, escribe y crea.

203790.name: Jet Racing Extreme
203790.description:
User Summary

Using a jet-propelled car, you complete stunts at high speeds on a twisty track.

203791.name: Angry Birds Pig Island Smashdown
203791.description:
Description from the publisher:

It’s pig smashing, Red crashing fun with the Angry Birds Pig Island Smashdown from Spin Master Games! Set up the Pigs and their Pig City in 1 of 24 ways and then smash Red into the precarious structure for maximum destruction! Or set up this 30” board to play Pig Bowling or Shuffleboard for hours or fun. It’s Red versus the Pigs in Angry Birds Pig Island Smashdown!

Use the 24 enclosed challenge cards to create the layout of the structures. With 6 blocks, 3 planks, and 3 pigs, there a multitude of challenges await! When built, you have 3 chances to slide an angry Red down the board to crash into the structures, toppling everything above.

203792.description:
The Thirty Years War was a series of conflicts that ravaged large areas of Europe, especially the German provinces, from 1618 to 1648. These conflicts centred on the Habsburg Holy Roman Emperors, Ferdinand II and Ferdinand III, and their opponents. Although viewed by many as a religious war between Catholic and Protestant nations, its roots and causes were also politically motivated. The combination of religious fervour and the political ambition of the European superpowers were to pit vast armies and mighty leaders against each other. The devastation caused by decades of fighting had truly turned Europe into the ‘Devil’s Playground’.

This supplement for Pike & Shotte describes the history, armies, personalities and battles of the Thirty Years War. Included are scenarios based on some of the famous battles and army lists for the main protagonists.
203792.name: Pike & Shotte: The Devil's Playground

203793.name: The Complete Netbook of Demons and their Relatives
203793.description:
User summary:

The Complete Netbook of Demons and their Relatives begins with an introductory statement about demons and demonology in Advanced Dungeons & Dragons and also presents an apparently exhaustive list of demon names mentioned in the official game materials. Several of those names not already detailed in any of the game's official products are here provided with statistics and descriptions.

Although the DOC version of the book is dated 1997, the completed work apparently was extant prior to ca. 1989 because no mention or allusion is made to tanar'ri et. al. or other aspects of 2nd edition.

203794.name: Mental Disorders
203794.description:
User summary:

Mental Disorders originally was released as an anonymous "A5 Booklet" to provide information to "help the DM to give both the PCs and NPCs a range of disorders to chose from", as well as to provide guidance, and occasionally game effects, for mental disorders during play. Disorders were roughly grouped according to cause. The text subsequently was circulated in ASCII and DOC formats.

203795.description:
From the publisher:

The peaceful hamlet of Blankenburg just grew a bit darker as the competition to construct the town intensifies. Builders of Blankenburg: Cutthroat allows players to take matters into their own hands in their quest to build the most prestigious structures in the town. Torch your opponents buildings, steal their silver or resources, even corrupt the bidding process for a turn. When fame and fortune are at risk, everyone has the tendency to behave a bit cutthroat.

The Cutthroat expansion for Builders of Blankenburg adds direct player vs. player cards to the mix, each a dastardly way to disrupt your opponents' plans and further your own goals. In addition to the Cutthroat cards, the expansion also adds additional Characters, Visitors, and Events, to ensure no two games are ever exactly the same.
203795.name: Builders of Blankenburg: Cutthroat

203796.name: The Great Elemental Netbook: A Guide to the Inner Planes, Part 1
203796.description:
From the introduction:

The Great Elemental Netbook is intended as a supplement to [adventuring in the Inner Planes]. It gives information about the inner planes, and about things connected to them.

User summary:

The Great Elemental Netbook was distributed in two parts only to manage the size of the document. The material is organized topically, and the division occurs at a logical place; however, the materials are intended to be used together. The book makes frequent reference to The Inner Planes and in many ways is a major expansion to the official product.

203797.name: The Great Elemental Netbook: A Guide to the Inner Planes, Part 2
203797.description:
User summary:

The Great Elemental Netbook was distributed in two parts only to manage the size of the document. The material is organized topically, and the division occurs at a logical place; however, the materials are intended to be used together. The book makes frequent reference to The Inner Planes and in many ways is a major expansion to the official product.

203798.name: Attack of the Killer Kittens
203798.description:
Attack of the Killer Kittens is a fast paced action card game, with kittens has your weapon, you've got 9 lives (cards in hand) and the goal is to be the last to survive (still have cards in hand) or have the most card when the drawing deck is empty.

You play one card per turn that affects the player to your left (either attack that does damage, defend that cancels attack or special cards). You can also stack damage cards, for example you play a 1 damage card and if the player to the left has the same card can play it to have is player to the left 2 damage instead of one.

Every time you play a card, you draw a card after. Only when you take damage that you don't draw a card.

203799.name: The Great Net Equipment List
203799.description:
User summary:

The Great Net Equipment List is organized as a series of tables grouping like items. The list enumerates thousands of commercial items and their cost, using standard Dungeons & Dragons prices. The items are not described, however. Many of the items, and the basic cost structure, are taken from official publications; many other items are derived from reader submissions.

Two major versions of the document were widely circulated - a Version 2 and a Version 3, with nearly twice as many items listed. Within each of these major versions, numerous minor variations exist.

203800.description:
The story so far...

The year is 1947. The war that started eight years ago with Germany invading Poland isn't over. The conflict has long since spread worldwide. Other than the three great blocs, there are but a handful of countries left hanging on to relative neutrality.

As the conflict grew longer, old alliances were broken while new ones were formed. Nowadays, the leading powers of the past are assembled into three huge states:

• The Allies have gathered around the U.S.A. This great coalition of nations includes, among others, the British Commonwealth and the French colonial empire.
• To secure their survival against their powerful enemies, Germany, Japan, and Italy have merged as the Axis. The rise of this totalitarian state was helped by the successful assassination of the Führer in 1943 following operation Walkyrie.
• The USSR and communist China have united their fates to build the SSU, or Sino-Soviet Union. Becoming a planetary power, the communist bloc intends to impose its way of life on all other continents.

Throughout the world, the three blocs are fighting to gain exclusive control over a revolutionary ore: Vk. This ore has revealed extraordinary properties and brought forth the design of gigantic combat robots, capable of challenging the world's most advanced tanks.

The discovery and first military applications of Vk came from Germany. Everything concerning this ore is shrouded in mystery. Rumors have been going around saying its secrets were revealed by aliens from another planet — but who could take such rumors seriously after years of war propaganda?
203800.name: Dust 1947

203801.name: M*A*S*H Game
203801.description:
Roll-and-move game. The object is to be the first to arrive at the Chopper Pad with a complete chopper and at least six wounded. A complete chopper is represented by three different cards you must collect - a nose, a middle, and a tail.

Each player plays as one of four characters from the show-- Hawkeye Pierce, Margaret Houlihan, BJ Hunnicut, or Klinger.

203802.description: This play mat measures 10 in. x 22 in. and is specifically designed for Dead Man's Draw.
203802.name: Dead Man's Draw: Playmat

203804.name: Robotech RPG Tactics: Zentraedi Glaug Command Pack
203804.description:
From the publisher:

Prepare for invasion with Robotech RPG Tactics! Take command of the deadly mecha fighting forces of the United Earth Defense Force, the Zentraedi Armada, or the Malcontents. Robotech RPG Tactics is an epic 6mm scale battle game where players control whole armies from the Robotech universe. Take to the battlefield to crush your friends in a dynamic tactical game where the outcome is always hanging in the balance. This diverse pack provides your Zentraedi forces with greater tactical capabilities; three figures total. 1 Glaug Officer's Battlepod - the fast and deadly mecha of Zentraedi field leaders., 1 Quel-Regult Scout Battlepod - the stealthy eyes and ears of your Zentraedi battle force; electronic warfare capabilities., and 1 Quel-Gulnau Recovery Pod - enhances the Glaug's ability to bring in Battlepod reinforcements. Note: This figure has NEVER before been offered by any company. Plastic game pieces. Assembly and painting required.

203805.name: Legend of the Five Rings: Dice
rpg: Legend of the Five Rings (4th Edition)
203805.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Through the partnership of Q-workshop and Alderac Entertainment Group, these unique and beautiful dice are designed especially for all the Great Clans in the game. In total, they sum up to nine clan designs and one special set for the Imperial Families. Each dice set contains ten D10 dice in the clan color with the clan symbol engraved instead of the highest number and comes in its own carefully designed packaging.

203806.name: The Complete.Net.Handbook
203806.description:
User summary:

The Complete.Net.Handbook presents an assortment of classes, character options, items, class kits, races, and house rules. The various entries are generally modular and can be used as desired. A second edition was planned but apparently never produced.

Most of the classes presented are specialist fighters or niche spell casters.

203807.name: Gothic Campaign Compendium
203807.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Gothic Campaign Compendium from Legendary Games is a beautiful 256-page hardback (or PDF) of lavishly detailed and lushly illustrated Gothic glory that will enliven and enrich any campaign that dabbles in the realms of horror. Within you will find:

- Over two dozen feats like Cultic Opiate, Flagellant Focus, Summon Star-Spawn, and Heart Ripper
- Archetypes like the Deviant wizard and Xenocidist ranger, along with new class abilities from alchemical discoveries like Aberrant Mutagen and Mutation Bomb to bardic masterpieces like Dance of the Empty Moons and Pnakotic Fugue.
- Over 70 brand-new horror-themed spells, from necrophagy to ancient mysteries, cannibalism to alien horrors from beyond the stars.
- Over two dozen malevolent monsters and terrifying templates like the bloodthirsty manikin, cyberphrenic tadpole, and living crematory.
- 30 new magic items dripping with creepiness, from minor consumables to artifact-level.
- Eight richly developed Gothic NPCs are contained here as well, each with a detailed history and connections to the official Gothic horror Adventure Path but easily usable in any campaign as rivals or allies.
- Three complete adventures by Greg Vaughan, Jason Nelson, and Clark Peterson, two for beginning-level characters and one for 10th-level characters.
- An entire chapter devoted to running a Gothic campaign, including alien invasions, mad scientists, mutants, madness, and the mythos.
- A gallery of creature illustrations, character portraits, foldable paper minis, and player-friendly maps, perforated for easy removal and use at the table.

If you are incorporating horror themes in your Pathfinder RPG campaign, this an indispensable resource for chilling surprises and horrifying new possibilities to your game. Brought to you by the Legendary Games team of Jason Nelson, Neil Spicer, Greg Vaughan, Clinton Boomer, and Clark Peterson, the Gothic Campaign Compendium has everything you need to Make Your Game Legendary.

This compilation includes the entire line of Gothic Grimoires: The Necrotic Verses, To Serve A Prince Undying, Spellbones Of The Devourer, The Sepulchral Swaths of Tanoth-Gha, On the Unseen Calculus of Inverse Refraction, plus The Mad Doctor's Formulary, Construct Codex, Treasury Of The Macabre,Tomes Of Ancient Knowledge, Cultic Cryptomancia, Beyond the Void, Gothic Heroes, Mutant Manifesto, Feasting at Lanterngeist, The Murmuring Fountain, and The Fiddlers Lament.

203808.name: The Guide to Herbs for RPGs
203808.description:
From the introduction:

Herbs have been a staple of fantasy literature for many years. Striders use of Athelas in “The Lord of the Rings” to cure Frodo, and Polgara’s herb lore in “The Belgariad” and “The Mallorean”, and Raistlin’s use of herbal teas to calm his cough in “Dragonlance” are two examples that come to mind.
...
This guide was written in order to allow a more detailed method of using the Herbalism Non Weapon Proficiency than that provided in the Player's Handbook (AD&D 2e). It may be used only by characters with the Herbalism proficiency. A revised Herbalism proficiency which can be used in any FRPG [also is provided].

User summary:

The document went through three major editions, though the 3rd Edition was not widely circulated (the 1st and 2nd Editions were not publicly circulated). While some game stats are provided, the sourcebook is easily used for any fantasy game.

203809.name: Playten
203809.description: Playten is a fun, creative game for children that will help their English vocabulary. By rolling a die and moving the pawn on the colourful snail, players try to collect all the cards that match the colour of their category card. Once a player completes his/her card, he/she must be the first player to pass the finish line on the snail in order to win.

203810.name: Helgraad
203810.description:
From the introduction:

Helgraad is a medium sized nation of the world of Fastivia. It is a feudal world with a standard of development approximately equal to that of England in the late 11th / early 12th century. At the commencement of the campaign (1,007 DD - by tradition 1,007 years after the death of Lord Davon, the governor of the first Imperial Colony on the island) King Gareth II has ruled for the last ten years. His grandfather Gareth I, Count of Helgravia became the first man to unite the island under one rule. His rule is typical of early medieval rule. He rules the islands simply by his ability to maintain the largest army, and to defeat any one Lord in battle. He would not be able to withstand a wide scale rebellion by a number of Lords. His ability to rule diminishes the further you travel from his capital of Helgravia.

User summary:

Helgraad was a house setting for a variety of fantasy role playing games, including Maelstrom (tabletop), Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (2nd Edition), and Middle-earth Role Playing (1st & 2nd Editions). The system is presented as online HTML, and is still available in an archive.

203811.name: Storm King's Thunder
203811.description:
Publisher blurb:

Take a stand against the giants in this adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game

Giants have emerged from their strongholds to threaten civilization as never before. Hill giants are stealing all the grain and livestock they can while stone giants have been scouring settlements that have been around forever. Fire giants are press-ganging the smallfolk into the desert, while frost giant longships have been pillaging along the Sword Coast. Even the elusive cloud giants have been witnessed, their wondrous floating cities appearing above Waterdeep and Baldur’s Gate. Where is the storm giant King Hekaton, who is tasked with keeping order among the giants?

The humans, dwarves, elves, and other small folk of the Sword Coast will be crushed underfoot from the onslaught of these giant foes. The only chance at survival is for the small folk to work together to investigate this invasion and harness the power of rune magic, the giants’ weapon against their ancient enemy the dragons. The only way the people of Faerun can restore order is to use the giants’ own power against them.
To defeat giants, you need to be giant!

rpgitemversion: Hardcover edition, limited-run hobby-store exclusive cover
203812.name: Volo's Guide to Monsters
203812.description:
Publisher blurb:

Immerse yourself in monster lore in this supplement for the world’s greatest roleplaying game
This is NOT just another Monster Manual! Volo’s Guide to Monsters provides something exciting for players and Dungeon Masters everywhere.

A deep dive into the lore behind some of D&D’s most popular and iconic monsters
Dozens of monsters new to the fifth edition to include in your epic adventures
New playable races to allow you to build characters to fit nearly any type of story in your D&D game.




The esteemed loremaster Volothamp Geddarm is back and he’s written a fantastical dissertation, covering some of the most iconic monsters in the Forgotten Realms. Unfortunately, the Sage of Shadowdale himself, Elminster, doesn’t believe Volo gets some of the important details quite right. Don’t miss out as Volo and Elminster square off (academically speaking of course) to illuminate the uninitiated on creatures both common and obscure. Uncover the machinations of the mysterious Kraken Society, what is the origin of the bizarre froghemoth, or how to avoid participating in the ghastly reproductive cycle of the grotesque vargouille. Dungeon Masters and players will get some much-needed guidance as you plan your next venture, traipsing about some dusty old ruin in search of treasure, lore, and let’s not forget ... dangerous creatures whose horns, claws, fangs, heads, or even hides might comfortably adorn the walls of your trophy room. If you survive.
Research has never been so dangerous!

203813.name: Net-Book of Heretic
203813.description:
User summary:

Net-Book of Heretic presents a variety of items, options, and monsters for general campaign use. The materials presented are all derived from id Software's computer game Heretic (1994). While knowledge of the computer game will assist in making complete "sense" of the items in this netbook, the various items and options can be adopted piecemeal.

An interesting aspect of the book is the parallel presentation of most items with two versions - one for so-called "wimpy" rules, and one for so-called "power" rules. This allows the various items to be used in either a traditional or an epic campaign.

203814.name: LISA
203814.description:
A game about survival, sacrifice, and perverts...

Lisa is a quirky side-scrolling RPG set in a post-apocalyptic wasteland. Beneath the charming and funny exterior is a world full of disgust and moral destruction. Players will learn what kind of person they are by being FORCED to make choices. These choices permanently effect the game play. If you want to save a party member from death, you will have to sacrifice the strength of your character. Whether it's taking a beating for them, or chopping off limbs, or some other inhuman way. You will learn that in this world being selfish and heartless is the only way to survive...

FEATURES:
- Visible character sacrifices that effect your stats (removing arms, eyes, scratches)
- Recruiting 30+ new party members in towns and camps.
- Ruthless choices that permanently effect towns, characters, life...
- White knuckle shopping cart races.
- Expending party members in Russian Roulette for huge profit, but perma-death if they lose.
- Countless hidden secrets in the world for you to explore.
- A life ruining gaming experience.

Source: The Game Website.

203815.name: Kumiliki: The Property Game
203815.description: Kimiliki is an Inland made monopoly-like game with some rule changes. It is made in Kenya with handmade carved soapstone figures, and the upgraded version includes carved hut houses and hotels instead of plastic. The board pictures the region in which the game is played. Like all other games in this genre, you will roll dice to move and purchase properties as you go; building upon them every round to start collecting more money from your fellow players.

203816.name: Dino Strike
203816.description:
User Summary

Use a variety of guns to take out the onslaught of rampaging dinosaurs in this on-rails lightgun shooter before they make you extinct!

203817.name: Grand Theft Auto IV: The Complete Edition
videogamecompilation: Grand Theft Auto IV: Episodes From Liberty City
203817.description: User summary: This disc contains Grand Theft Auto IV as well as the Episodes from Liberty City expansion.

203818.name: Akua
203818.description:
In Akua, each of 2-4 players is a brave explorer venturing to the fabled islands of the Akua. These isles are ruled by the Akua, ancient beings of incredible wisdom and power. Players explore these islands, collect various Mana stones, and commune with the Akua. Each of these actions potentially grant the player points in different ways, and possibly additional actions! At the end of the game, the player with the highest score wins.

Akua is played over a series of rounds, with each player receiving 3 specific turns per round.

Akua includes a single component: a printed plastic game board. The game is played using this board and 4 dry erase markers.

203820.name: Deep Water
203820.description:
User Summary

Travel around in your boat hunting for sharks. Sell your catches to upgrade your boat and equipment to catch bigger prey.

203821.name: Shadows of Esteren: Cave Tiles
203821.description:
From the package insert:

This supplement for Shadows of Esteren includes five sets of cardboard tiles depicting the tunnels and halls of a cave. Features include:


About thirty different tiles divided into 5 sets
Specially intended for the A Life Choice scenario
One-inch scale: use your favorite miniatures!
Arrange the tiles as you like to design your own locations!


Good luck in the Shadows...

203823.name: Stubborn Pigs
203823.description:
This tiny two-player board game consists of two cardboard pigs mounted on wooden stands, and a long unfolding paper strip (13" x 3") with horizontal lines representing 28 steps from Home to Market. A teetotum is used to advance each pig in turn, with every step including an event that cause the pig to either gain or lose additional steps.

While there is neither publisher nor date marked on the box, board or rules, the game is identified as an upcoming release by Milton Bradley in American Stationer on May 29, 1890.

203824.description:
A promotional card and character given out during the 2016 Watch It Played Indiegogo campaign.

This promo includes a new character, standee, and Crossroads card.
203824.name: Dead of Winter: Rodney Smith

203826.name: Parley-Mutual
203826.description:
This horse-racing game, undated but likely 1930s, uses a deck of cards to determine movement. The game contains six thick cardboard cards, each having a track of 12 holes from Start to Finish. Each track is marked with one of the suits and represents the horses "Club Foot", "Diamond Jim", "Spade Tail", and "Heart Throb".

For the basic Stake Race game, each player turns over a card, the horse of the drawn suit moves ahead one space, and the owning player must pay $1 into the stakes. First to reach the finish takes the accumulated stakes.

There are additional rules for Steeplechase, Handicap, Daily Double and Hi-Stepping races, as well as a Number-Pool game that can be added to any of them.

If more than six people play at once, a second deck of cards is required.

203827.name: Tiddledy Winks: 5 Different Games Complete
203827.description:
This 1935 publication from Milton Bradley was clearly issued to compete with Parker Bros. earlier Tiddledy Winks Bowling. In addition to the standard Tiddledy Winks game, there is a board inset in the box set up like a dartboard with 10 segments and values ranging from 5 to 15.

The game Spot Tiddledy Winks requires snapping winks onto the board and totalling the scores (highest wins), while the Game of Forty-Five requires snapping five winks on a turn, with the player getting closest to 45 without going over winning.

There also are two bowling games included. One involves setting up ten wooden pins in a standard bowling triangle on the table, with three snaps per turn and resetting the pins after each player turn. Players score one point per pin downed, and highest total after 10 turns wins.

In the other bowling game, the pins are set up on the board in the 10 segments around the cup. The score per pin downed depends on the board segment.

203828.description:
Play the Cold War in 13 minutes.

13 Minutes: The Cuban Missile Crisis is a card-driven microgame with tough decisions. Playing as either Kennedy or Khrushchev, your aim is to exit the Cuban Missile Crisis as the most powerful superpower. During the game you play only five strategy cards that you use to place Influence on battlegrounds to score majorities or manipulate battlegrounds. Each card you play turns into a new battleground, so the "world map" is ever-changing. Be careful because each decision is important and you may trigger global nuclear war!

13 Minutes, a sequel of sorts or different take on 13 Days, builds on the classic microgame genre heralded by Love Letter, but 13M uses the card-driven game mechanism to ensure that the five cards you play each game all adds up to agonizing choices!
203828.name: 13 Minutes: The Cuban Missile Crisis
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 28 - Scythe Review

203829.name: The Adventurers Guild
203829.description:
From the introduction:

The idea behind Haven Cross is to provide a flexible and fun experience to both players and DMs.
...
The quest [presented is] called An Exhausting Delivery and is for low level characters and is a nice introduction to the game for new players.

User summary:

A well-developed "base of adventure" setting with an introductory scenario for beginning characters.

203830.name: The (More or Less) Complete Guide to AD&D Hygiene
203830.description:
User summary:

The (More or Less) Complete Guide to AD&D Hygiene covers such vital topics as how often characters use the restroom, how paladins can stay clean, when characters should visit the dentist, and how clerics can help keep the area free of humanoid waste. Even a mage has to do laundry.

The item has a fairly complex publication history, with an initial major version released in 1993 and revised in 1994 (but still called the 1993 version). The 1994 revision is the most widely circulated and was converted into DOC format in 2000. A major revision of the Text version also occurred in 1996, greatly expanding the topics covered.

P.S. How often do characters have to use the restroom? Their CON score with a multiplier applied in hours apart. And it varies by sex.

203832.name: Battle Forever
203832.description:
In this arcade Beat 'em Up you can choose between four different characters. Take your favourite and start punching the bad guys. The evil Professor S. tries to create the ultimate warrior in order to conquer the whole country. You have to stop him!

Source: The Developer Website.

203833.description:
The Mountaineer is a 3D tabletop board game in which players climb a mountain, completing special climbing routes and competing for climbing points. Multiple climbing routes and ten different mountain sides result in over twenty million game combinations.

Gameplay involves players rolling dice to determine weather and climbing conditions, trading with other players to obtain climbing gear, and selling the climbing gear to purchase special upgrades. Upgrades can increase climbing efficiency, change climbing conditions, sabotage other players, and even pay for helicopter flights to another place on the mountain. As players climb, they mark where they have been, resulting in the mountain displaying their trail and potentially blocking other players from climbing in that area.

The goal of the game is to finish all of the climbing routes and place as many route markers on the mountain as possible. This earns climbing points, with the player having the most climbing points winning the game.
203833.name: The Mountaineer
boardgamepodcastepisode: HLG 10: Meer Essen

203834.name: Music Wars Empire
203834.description:
Jump into the music industry with Music Wars Empire! Take the role of a manager or CEO of a record label, and try to make your mark on the music industry! Whether you want to start small and create your own indie record company to cultivate quality releases, or aim big and pursue the more lucrative commercial pop markets while buying out the opposition, the choice is yours!

Source: The Developer Website.

203835.description:
There's an epic battle of wits being slyly waged among you and your roommates. No one speaks of it, or even acknowledges its existence, but when it comes to taking out the garbage, it's all about the art of the dodge. In the pursuit of avoidance, each dexterously stacked banana peel represents a small victory. That candy wrapper hidden in the deep recesses of your room is a silent success. But the greenish milk carton you secretly stashed under your roommate's bed, that was a stroke of genius! That is, until you get caught making a mess while everyone else pretends they would never be so childish — as to get caught. Be careful and be cunning because only the champion can gloat in a hammock while everyone else lugs out the trash on garbage day.

In Garbage Day, players take turns stacking garbage cards one at a time onto the overflowing garbage can, or stashing garbage cards in their rooms. But once a player's room gets too full, they must clean it by stacking all the cards from that room on top of the garbage can, very carefully, one by one. If garbage cards fall off the garbage can during your turn, place them in your overflow pile. If your overflow pile gets too big, you're eliminated from the game. If all other players have been eliminated, you win!

Garbage Day (Limited Edition) comes in a silver can and includes the Garbage Day: Smelly Expansion (21 cards).
203835.name: Garbage Day (Limited Edition)

203836.name: Mary and John or They Lived Happily Ever After
203836.description:
This is a third game in the series done by Howard R. Garis for Milton Bradley along with Uncle Wiggily and Jack and Jill or Who Brought the Water. In this game, Mary and John can each start from one of four corners, merging at a central plaza after 10 spaces.

At various stops along the way to their Wedding Ring at space 150, they can encounter a Lunch Room, Movie Theater, Soda Shop, Cigar Store, Dress Maker, Cabaret, Barber, Candy Shop, Shoe Store and Dentist, each of which sends Mary and John in different directions (forward and back).

203838.name: Massive Cleavage vs Zombies
203838.description:
User Summary

Your mission is to find BBQ sauce for your people and bring it back to them. Fighting off thousands of zombies with only your massive cleaver and equally massive cleavage.

203839.name: Orc's Breath (Issue 3 - 1987)
rpg: Fighting Fantasy: The Introductory Role-Playing Game
Judge Dredd the Role-Playing Game (Games Workshop)
203839.description:
Orc's Breath
Issue 3
1987

Features: Fighting Fantasy, Lone Wolf, Marvel Super-Heroes, Dungeon Quest, Fury of Dracula, Warhammer, White Dwarf, Judge Dredd, Games Workshop, and Citadel Miniatures.

203840.name: Unbreakable Vr Runner
203840.description:
https://www.facebook.com/UnbreakableVrRunner

It is a coin catcher game in which the player collects coins and others objects and dodges obstacles.

203841.name: Cricket Captain 2016
203841.description:
It’s time for cricket fans from around the world to put their cricketing expertise to the test with the most in-depth Cricket Captain game ever made.

Source: The Developer Website.

203842.name: The Net Tome of Magick
203842.description:
User summary:

The Net Tome of Magick presents dozens of new spells for use by spell casters. Wizard spells heavily outnumber Clerical spells. In addition to enumerating new spells, the document presents numerous magical system options, including spells far above the 9-level limit used in the official rules (Wizard spells to 20th level and Cleric spells to 12th level). This expansion also includes new spell progression tables, etc.

Note this document incorporates and adapts some materials previously published in The Tome of Mighty Magic.

203843.name: Magical Compendium of Novel Incantations
203843.description:
From the introduction:

I, the archaeologist Mistroom Everglance, have explored many ancient sites to bring to you the knowledge amassed in the Compendium you now hold before you. Accompanied by only the best adventurers I have entered ruined keeps and the long abandoned towers of famous sorcerers. Here I found the spells of old masters of magic like Dreamweaver and Ingmar.

By far most spells however I have found in safer places. The Master Transmuter of the gnomic University of Magic of Oredig has granted me to search through the tomes he made as a young adult, and the vast library of the elves of Faruel proved a rich source of spells from the famous half-elven transmutress known as the Green Orion.

In this tome I present you not only these ancient spells, but also the much newer findings of that famous gnomic illusionist Onno Trickthought, whom I met at the University of Rockhome.

Apart from these wizard's spells, I have endeavoured to bring together a large amount of priestly prayers. These I found in the annals of the orders of Solonor Thelandria, Corellon Larethian, Dugmaren Brightmantle and Gaia. I hereby thank these priesthoods for their invaluable contributions.

Because of safety precautions, this tome only presents spells from the first to the fifth level. Higher level spells will be included in a future edition of this tome, which will only be accessible by members of the gnomic universities and faithful priests of the above mentioned orders.

Still, be careful in the examination of the spells contained in this book, and refrain from inappropriate use of their powers.

User summary:

Includes wizard and cleric spells from 1st through 5th level. The spells are organized by class, level, and then alphabetically. The document went through several revisions. The final revision was translated into Dutch.

203844.name: Pat's the Bhoy
203844.description:
This is a ring-toss game with an 8" tall caricature cut-out of a Celtic lad held upright by two wooden blocks at the back of the box. The bottom of the box is divided into six colored squares.

The cut-out's pointed ears are worth 6 points each; his club and pipe on the sides 3 points and his hat 4 points. The squares on the board range from minus 4 to plus 5.

Although undated, the style of the artwork suggests 1930s.

203845.description:
Dig Down Dwarf is a fast-paced press-your-luck dice game that was the winner of the Micro Game Challenge! 128 designs were entered into the contest and Dig Down Dwarf was unanimously picked #1 overall by the judges! The Micro Game Challenge was judged by board game critic Cyrus Kirby, who is better known as Father Geek, and by the podcast team at All Us Geeks.

Dig Down Dwarf is a fast and casual game that is fun for all ages and all skill levels. Newcomers will be attracted to the easy-to-learn rules and press-your-luck mechanics, while skilled gamers will love the ability to alter dice rolls by spending gems and to activate special dwarven powers. There is a bit of something for everyone, and the quick playtime and portability make it a great travel game and an outstanding filler game as well.

What is New in the Second Edition

Objective Cards - This new edition will come with 18 Objective Cards. Players will randomly draw 3 at the beginning of the game and these will become a way to score bonus points at the games end. Players decide, as a group, if the objectives are be kept secret or placed up for all to see.

New Artwork - Second Edition comes with clean new graphic design work and artwork throughout. You will still recognize some of the icons and fonts, but the new design is meant to convey a sense of nostalgia.

More Gems - Second Edition comes with 20% more of the shiny gems that made the First Edition such a smash hit!

Six Player Support - With the addition of extra gems and other components, Dig Down Dwarf Second Edition can host up to six players.

New Dwarf Power Cards - These new cards utilize acrylic cubes to track the dwarven skills you have unlocked during the course of the game, instead of rotating the card like you had to do in the older version.

New Dice Colors - Like the new Dwarf Power Cards, we have listened to the feedback over the course of hundreds of plays since the first Kickstarter over two years ago. One thing I noticed was players not noticing that they triggered a dwarf power, because each dice was a different color and it was too much to keep track of for many. A very simple solution has been implemented. You now roll three black dice and one red die on your turn. The red die activates everyone's dwarven powers.

New Gem Colors - Another complaint we got was that some of the gems looked alike in color. We made sure to make that a non-issue this time around. Star gems are now really yellow and we are now able to manufacture the gems in black for the cursite (fossilized dragon dung) which further helps distinguish each gem type.
203845.name: Dig Down Dwarf (Second Edition)

203846.name: Shinshannara
203846.description:
From the introduction:

Shinshannara is a small, moonless world, close to its weak, light orange sun. A year is comprised of 10 months, each counting 27 days of 24 hours.

User summary:

Shinshannara was a campaign setting developed from 1999 through abt. 2001, and published on the internet as a series of HTML pages. It was comprised of several pages of information and a few dozen color maps of various regions.

203848.name: The Medfly Game
203848.description:
This satirical roll and move game for two players pits then and current California Governor Jerry Brown against the Mediterranean fruit fly, which first was seen in the state in 1975, and became a scourge to the state's agricultural industry in subsequent years. The spread of the Medfly created a political crisis in 1981 for Gov. Brown, and led to the start of aerial spraying in the state. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1989_California_medfly_attack).

Most squares on the game track are either California counties or products, with their populations and annual agricultural production value listed. Players who land on a crop space take a card with a joke event that boosts one player and penalizes the other. The Brown player deploys four Malathion tokens and the Medfly player four larva tokens, which act as landmines sending the other player back four spaces.

If the Jerry Brown player wins, he makes it to the U.S. Senate and becomes a potential presidential candidate for 1984. If not, his political ambitions are crushed.

203849.name: Children of the Night (5e)
203849.description:
Monsters and Rules for Ravenloft and the Curse of Strahd

From the introduction:

This book contains a wealth of classic monsters for the Ravenloft Campaign Setting, updated from both the 2nd Edition and 3rd Edition of the Dungeons & Dragons rulesets.

The monsters of this book were primarily found in Monstrous Compendium, Ravenloft Appendices I & II and Ravenloft Monstrous Compendium Appendix III: Creatures of Darkness, and full information on the habitat, societies, and ecologies of these monsters is included in those products. I heartily recommend these products be purchased for full use of this PDF. However, the monster statblocks are complete, and self-contained, so there is all the information needed to run each of these monsters in this book.

User summary:

All entries have been updated to conform with the format and standards established in Monster Manual (D&D 5e).

203850.name: Underdark Enemies
203850.description:
Rage of Demons Foes

From the introduction:

The Underdark is home to a range of intelligent and not-so intelligent foes. Drow and fire giants are known enemies, but as demons erupt from the abyss into the Underdark a deadly world pitches into madness.

A set of ten foes for your Rage of Demons campaign.

203851.name: A Forgotten Evil
203851.description:
From the front of the module:

In ages past, nations fought great wars with the aid of powers from fiendish allies. Much has been forgotten since then, but sometimes that which is forgotten can be the greatest danger of all.

Goblins are raiding the small villages near Caer Carega. Is it just the depredations of a few desperate tribes, or is there something more sinister behind the night raids?

An Adventure for Characters Levels 1-3.

203852.name: The Net Monstrous Compendium
203852.description:
User summary:

The Net Monstrous Compendium enumerates hundreds of fan-created monsters, many with multiple varieties. Additionally, several "official" monsters are revised or altered to provide variant versions. All entries use a standardized "stat block" and format. As with any compilation of this type, the quality of the entries varies considerably.

The initial "Version 1" of the document was created and published in LaTeX format. The Follow-up "Version 2" of the document was expanded and presented in ASCII format. This version was made available for download as seven separate files or as a single "compiled" file. A DOC format of the compiled Version 2 document also was available.

203853.name: The Net Book of Names
203853.description:
User summary:

The Net Book of Names is a relatively straightforward resource that supports any style of fantasy role-playing game, though it is aimed specifically at Advanced Dungeons & Dragons. The item is distributed as six ASCII files (usually in a ZIP archive). One file lists contributors, the remaining five files each list names for specific topics (People, Location, Item, Business, and Miscellaneous). The coverage of each topic is uneven.

A later formatting presented a combined resource in a single document.

203854.name: Net AD&D Players Supplement
203854.description:
User summary:

The Net AD&D Players Supplement is a compilation of various resources, primarily aimed at players. It is organized topically and presents new Classes, Proficiencies, and Spells. It also presents variant experienced and advancement systems, a method for changing class, and a variety of variant combat systems.

203856.name: Gamer Deck 2: Theme
203856.description:
Gamer Deck is a series of card decks that appeal to gamers and game designers. Each deck will be more like a card system than a standard deck of cards. A card system has multiple elements to be used to play and design many games.

Gamer Deck 2 - Theme is like a standard deck of cards because it has 4 suits (A-K). The suits are cards, meeples, hexes and pawns. There is an RGB color scheme to the deck. There are dice images on each card. The cards are numbered 1-52. Each card has a letter and 3 game themes on each of the 3 colors.

203858.description:
Praktika is a cooperative game for "adult or fairly adult" players that bills itself as "the only useful social game". The goal is to get the playing piece to the end of the Snakes and Ladders-esque board and communally answer trivia questions to avoid getting penalty tokens that might end the game in a loss. Some questions have no clear-cut answers and players are encouraged to discuss freely (and even disregard the answers given if they disagree with them).

This is a translated and adapted version of the Canadian game Untrivia by Jim Deacove. In addition to including legal, historical and social questions appropriate for a Swedish context, the layout of the board is different and the categories for questions are fewer.
203858.name: Praktika

203859.name: arrow
203859.description:
User Summary

Arrow is a snake variant. In this game you control a snake eating objects and trying not to run into yourself but the objects have numbers on them as well indicating additional points and snake length you will get for eating it.

203860.name: Artillery
203860.description: Players take turns firing artillery shots at each other. Providing the angle and gunpowder level. Win changes do take place. Levels are randomly generated and shots leave craters. If you hit the other player the game ends.

203861.name: Bagels
203861.description:
Bagels is a game similar to Mastermind. You must guess the computer's code and the computer will guess yours. Codes are four letters long and made up of letters A-F in any order.

Whoever guesses the others code first wins.

203862.name: Ballon Redden
203862.description:
User Summary

Ballon Redden is a game where you attempt to keep a balloon alive by raising and lowering it to avoid obstacles.

203863.name: Baseball (1977)
203863.description:
User Summary

Baseball is a topdown baseball simulation for 2 players. One player has 6 different pitches they can choose from. The other can swing the bat.

Normal baseball rules apply.

203864.name: Bets
203864.description:
User Summary

Bets is a representation of the card game Indian Poker. The player plays against 3 cpu players. Each player has 1 card that they cannot see but the other players can. Betting is based on your guess whether you hold the highest card or not.

203865.name: Blockade Special!
203865.description:
User Summary

Blockade Special! Is a game similar to snake. In this game you are trying to escape from a maximum security prison. You move around collecting boxes and scoring points for each step you take. Robots will set electric fences in random positions that must be avoided.

203866.name: Solarix
203866.description:
User Summary

Wandering an instellar space station, you restore power and seek to complete objectives set by the AI, containing an infection outbreak and rescuing crew members.

203867.name: Slimmer Man: The Getaway
203867.description:
Run thru the forest and survive all you can cause Slimmer Man is behind!

As one of the six archetypes, you alone (or with a friend) have to walk your way out from the forest. Survive till you getaway or walk into Slimmer man's arms and yeah that's not a choice.

The board is composed of 9 Forest Cards. One of the cards (the start card) is dealt face up and the others? Shuffle them and then place them in a 3x3 formation.

Each turn you one step on the Forest cards. Each time you step on a new Forest card you turn it upright to see what you have to do while you are there. Some cards tell you to shuffle specific board cards, one lets you take a Light token and there is one you never want to find; Slimmer Man’s Card that makes you get a Fear token.

How to win? Walk around the board 10 times without finding Slimmer Man, but if he gets you, you receive a Fear token and you and your partner steps by the Forest are back to zero, but if you have Light token and Slimmer Man appear light him instead of receiving a Fear token. With 4 times that you give Light Slimmer Man or 10 steps through the Forest are enough to win.

203868.name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Condition Alert Resource
boardgamefamily: Star Trek: Attack Wing Miniatures Game
203868.description:
The Condition Alert Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in "The Corbomite Maneuver" episode Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 5 Squadron Points.

When using this Resource, you receive 6 Mission tokens on the Resource at the start of the game. If one of your ships still has a single Evade or Battle Stations Token beside it at the end of the round, you may spend one of the Mission tokens to retain that action token into the next round, instead of removing it during clean-up.

203870.name: Deception: Murder in Hong Kong – GameBoyGeek Season 4 Kickstarter Promo
203870.description:
2 promo cards available as part of kickstarter promo collection
Saxophone - Means/Weapon
Tripod - Clue

203872.name: Kreuz und quer
203872.description:
Each player has 4 playing pieces that he has to get to the 4 home spaces of his own color. At the beginning, the playing pieces are put on the table top down and are shuffled. Then they are placed randomly on all home spaces. After the colors are dispensed among the players, the playing pieces are turned up to reveal their colors. Movement is straight in all directions, but not diagonal, any number of spaces. Jumping over other playing pieces is not permitted. The first player to get all 4 playing pieces onto his home spaces wins the game.

The game was published between 1938 and 1940.

203873.name: Nallarnas favoritspel
203873.description:
A children game with two games in one with cute bears as playing pieces.

Game 1 is a adaption of the kids game Musical chairs. Every player start with 6 chairs and the last standing is the winner.

Game 2 are the bears on a trail looking for their sweets for the picnic. The first bear to collect alla of their sweets wins.

203875.name: Poisoner's Pour
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 63: Sunday, July 24th
203875.description:
Each round one player will be the Pourer. They will take the Drink Cards and decide where the poison will be placed around the Center Mat. The Center Mat has 5 places to set drinks that
give 0 to 3 Gold to the person that takes from it. Starting with the player on the Pourer's left, each player will take a Drink Card and adjust their Gold level based on where they took the
drink from. Once every player has taken a Drink Card the Pourer will take the last one for themselves. All players will then Reveal which Drink Card they have taken and adjust their
Poison level accordingly. When a player reaches 10 Gold or is the last one standing they win.

What makes Poisoner's Pour tricky is figuring out where the Pourer placed the poison. They can tell you as little or as much as they like and are probably lying when they do. Or are they?
Can you guess where they would place it knowing that they know you are trying to out­think them? Are they counting on you to know that you know they know your are trying to think like them? You just have to take a drink and hope you know them as well as you think you do.

203876.name: The Net Book of Plots
203876.description:
From the introduction:

The Net Book of Plots is a collection of adventure ideas. These ideas are classified by length, genre, type, and setting to make it easier to find the right plot for your game.
...
These lists can be used for a variety of role playing games.

User summary:

The Net Book of Plots is published as six separate ASCII files (Volume 1 - Volume 6), or as The Complete Edition of the Net Books of Plots, a compiled ASCII version with all six volumes. Additionally, the complete product is available as HTML in both a downloadable version and an online version. The online version supports useful indexing options.

Although the plots presented are generic and universal, many of them have a heavy fantasy genre component and many are obviously intended for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (2nd Edition).

203877.name: Slice of the Blade
203877.description:
From the introduction:

Slice of the Blade, is a dip into the Old World and the Old Ways as the kesshi get caught up in a division over dueling. Set in Sorimizu , shall our heroes lend their swords to the cause? Includes all new dueling Edges for those who wish to add a bit more bite to their blades.

203878.name: Intellectual Property
203878.description:
From the introduction:

Intellectual Property is a freeform larp for 5 - 50 players in which you will play teenagers at school going through their first day of government training to protect their minds from terrorist attacks. The game requires players to make no overt attempts at communication and relies on audio and propaganda to keep players distracted, occupied and frustrated.

User summary:

The game is comprised of three files:

- GPM for Minors Leaflet (1-page PDF player handout)
- Intellectual Property (4-page PDF game document)
- Intellectual Protection Routine (59:50 MP3 sound file)

203879.name: Rest
203879.description:
From the introduction:

Rest is a dream sequence generation game, designed to create moments of revelation for fictional characters. It is a game-within-a-game, played between sessions of a traditional tabletop role-playing game when characters find themselves with time to sleep. Using a character from this existing game, The Writer and Player work together to create the story of a meaningful dream that that character experience during this downtime, and to decide what revelations they take from it.

User summary:

The game is comprised of three files:

- Rest (22-page PDF)
- Rest (9-page PDF text)
- The Tower (8-page PDF text; play sample)

203881.name: Uncanny Valley
203881.description:
From the introduction:

Uncanny Valley is centered around an android victim of an autonomous assault filing a police report regarding the incident. The game's action takes place within a police interrogation room and concerns the interactions between the android, two officers, and a Police Sketch Artist. Each of these characters carries their own prejudices and goals and may seek contradictory outcomes. The game facilitator handles game setup, answers questions, delivers roleplay prompts, and fills an auxiliary character role as a Police Station Intern.

User summary:

The game is comprised of three files:

- 1 Introduction (3-page PDF game document)
- 2 Facilitator Briefing document (5-page PDF guide)
- 3 Character Sheets (4-page print-and-play document)

203882.name: The Adventurers Guild Map Pack
203882.description:
Publisher blurb:
